description:
This is a fabulous place the type of which is unfortunately disappearing. Very low key vibe with many different types of background music, depending who is bar tending. No pretension. They have a very sophisticated and wide range of spirits, as well as local beer and wine. The cigar selection is not huge, but it does change from week to week. You can sometimes smoke cigarettes if that's your thing, but you shouldn't count on it.  

What really makes this place special is what it is beyond fine cigars, whiskeys, and scotches. All five bartenders (who are actually owners) are very different and unique personalities. I have had long and wonderful conversations with each of them. In addition, the clientele is very diverse, not just racially, but in terms of interests, politics, and other. I have met the most interesting people here and have had very insightful conversations with many of them. I often learn something new.  It's not cheap, but it is well worth a visit.
author: George B.

description:
DO NOT VISIT THIS ESTABLISHMENT unless you want to get a $400 surprise on your tab. I am a member of a few cigar lounges and decided to try this bar/lounge. When I first arrived I ordered a simple rum on the rocks.  I ordered a second drink and it was different. The bar tender told me I might want to finish that drink. After asking for the tab I now know why. He informed me that I asked for some 30 year rum and that is why I had 8 $50 charges. You would think the bartender would inform a customer that they were paying for a $400 glass of rum and most would probably decline. I enjoy rum and can't even remember the last time I seen even a bottle of rum that was over $400. He must be getting a commission or pocketing the money. Stay far away!!!!!

UPDATE: I went to my financial institution and found out the establishment tried to charge my card 4 transactions of $79, 2-$279 transactions and a 1-$479 transaction. Glad my bank caught onto this establishment trying to over charge. I urge all to stay away unless you want to get ripped off by this bar.
author: Jason D.

description:
A half block away the aroma of cigars leads you to a little store with a modest selection of fine cigars and perhaps one of the best stocked shelf of libations in The City. 

Perhaps a dozen stools surrounding the bar with a few high tops and tables. You're greeted by a charming proprietor and order up a drink and a smoke. You can BYOCigar to enjoy with a nominal clip charge. No cigarettes, not allowed.  

As an alcoholic, I noticed a huge selection of spirts and wine. Truly a well thought out array of unique top shelf choices. The beer list is equally extensive and fairly priced. Even the non-alcoholic offerings feature Fever Tree from the UK. 

Not expecting to enjoy a smoke and not bringing a favorite, I chose an Aston Corona, is mild and has a smooth draw. With the fatter gauged cigars, I prefer a punch rather than a cut. I think it provides a boulder taste. My 5.5x44 was delicious and burned evenly for a relaxing 45 minutes. 

While still prefer to sit in a comfy chair at home or in the lounges of Las Vegas, Occidental provides the rare and local opportunity to relax and be totally in the cigar zone.
author: David N.

description: In town for a visit. Great cigar lounge to end the night of at. Owner was more than accommodating, answered our every question and just a gem I. The city.
author: Bhimer K.

description: Great... except the price of the limited selection of cigars. Two to three times the price I pay locally at home. So, too bad - everything else was as expected.
author: Malcolm D.

description:
I went out with a few people who were looking for a place to smoke and sip whiskey at the same time. The Occidental Cigar Club came up as a top result and the ratings on Yelp were promising. We went on a Tuesday night around 6:30pm and the place was just starting to get busy. 

The bartender was quick to ask for our IDs and required a tab to be opened on a credit card. We already knew what kind of cigars to pick from the limited selection they had. You'll pay a premium for these to offset the high cost of rent in San Francisco. You can optionally pay a BYOC $5 cutting fee and smoke one of your own. The place feels like a speakeasy with the layout. There aren't many places like that here in the city. Service was good. We received several samples from the bartender to try out before picking one. 

We left around 8pm and the place was in full swing. Not bad for a Tuesday night...
author: Tim G.

description:
I have been to the Occidental a few times when traveling for work.  I usually go with a couple of co-workers who are whiskey drinkers so the Occidental is top on our list.  They have quite the selection of whiskey, from Laphroaig to Hakushu and all those in between.  I think they carry other alcohol but I can't get past all the delightful scotch and whiskey :-P.  I read the other reviews of the rudeness of Yvette...I have yet to see it.  She was pleasant and fun.  Picked me the exact right cigar - paired nicely with the whiskey I was drinking.  
As for race determining service, I respectfully disagree - there were several people of different race (hope I am being politically correct) and they all seemed to be having a good time and getting service.  
The Occidental is on my go to list when I am in SF for a whiskey and cigar.  I would recommend to my friends.
author: Tara F.

description: Awesome place to have a drink and cigar. The co-owner lady was friendly and helpful. I got there early but the place got really busy. Strongly recommended if in sf or visiting sf
author: Kamran N.

description:
Nice place. Good service. Beautiful selection of alcohol. Modest selection of cigars. Some great things about this place:
1) you can smoke a cigar in peace without being scrutinized (minus the loud mouth yuppy and his Dr. wife bragging all night to a poor out of town couple)
2)the ambiance is unique and fun
3) service is good

All in all a good place to unwind, however prices are pretty steep (i know Sfo rent is high) and the 5 dollar charge to cut your own cigar is unnecessary . I always buy cigars from an establishment but i can see some people not liking the cigar selection. If that is the case, these people most all the time buy a lot of drinks thus mitigating the loss of revenue on  inventory cigars.
author: Al Z.

description:
My wife and I visited this location from NY.  We were there only a few minutes and I was blown away how rude the bartender was.  I commented to my wife that I had read some reviews prior to our visit and remembered the name Yvette who had received so many poor reviews.  Sure enough we finally figured her name out and yes it was Yvette.  What a piece of garbage!!!

We will never visit this location again period.  She looks and acts like a train wreck behind the bar.  Why bother typing each rude act no reason.  We finished our drinks quickly smoked the rest of the cigars outside and did not give the establishment another penny.  Bye bye loser.
author: Timothy H.

description:
While this place is relatively small in size (seats ~20-25 people) it is large in stature. Based on pictures alone, it reminded me of speakeasy type place. And it did not disappoint. To assist with the speakeasy type of feeling, I arrived to find a 1937 Buick parked out front. While it did not belong to the Occidental staff it definitely helped set the mood for my entry into the bar (more on the car later). 

Once inside I found the place to be more of a bar (which allows cigars) versus being a true cigar bar. That said, it was nicely laid out with an ample amount of bar stools/tables along with seating at the bar. The typical leather sofa/lounge chair seating found at most cigar bars was nowhere to be found. Although the front door was open, the ventilation system seemed to be decent. There are also a couple of TVs which at the time were showing sports. 

As I already mentioned, this is less a cigar lounge and more of a bar that sells cigars. There is a small humidor which contained some very nice high end sticks. Considering what was available, I thought the prices were acceptable ($20 for good cigars and closer to $30 for the really good ones). Also, outside cigars can be brought in. There is a $5 cutting fee for them. There was one bartender on duty. He was friendly and did a great job of keeping up with the various orders. 

Lastly, as I mentioned there was a 1937 Buick parked out front which was in pristine condition. Approximately 20 minutes after I arrived, the owner walked in. He was dressed the part; long trench coat, fedora, double-breasted suit and two tone lace up shoes. I share this as it helps to highlight the the ambiance of Occidental; sort of a Roaring Twenties/Thirties feel. I thoroughly enjoyed the bar and will definitely return on my next visit to the area.
author: Willis C.

description:
That's rightt, as one part of my boyfriend's 26th birthday (he no longer qualifies as a young adult :p), I took him to a real cigar shop!  My boyfriend had been a smoker for nearly 10 years, but recently started to try to quit his addiction, for me. Nicotine addictions are hard to kick, and it was his birthday after all -- he wanted a pack of cigarettes, I had made plans to take him here; it all worked out perfectly! 

The shop is small, but more of a cozy small rather than a overcrowded small. The setup is similar to one you would find at your typical bar, with the bartender/owner behind the counter helping you. It's very dark here, but I like it... It felt like I was in one of those 1920's black/white romance movies (haha, half-kidding..) 

We didn't really know much about cigars so we left it up to the guy who runs the place to pick one with the whiskey we ordered. Given this task, he walked over to one of his several glass cabinets where he picked one up for us. It was a really fun experience, but I wish that he had spoken to us a bit more, or at least told us what cigar he had chosen and why. 

Final thoughts: I'd definitely come back, but only after maybe studying up/dabbling in smoking cigars a bit more. But honestly, just the thought of cigars and whiskey... it seems like the perfect evening to me!
author: Evelynn C.

description: Awesome spot for a cigar, whiskey and banter with the bartender! Definitely going back!
author: Tristan K.

description: Great stop midday downtown for a stogie and a drink if you like. Staff was very friendly!   Recommend to anybody who is in the area visiting or not!
author: Les L.

description: I was here on 2/20/18. The bartender, Yvette Cervantes sucks ass. She seems to be very selective with the customers she wants to be friendly with. If you scroll down and find a customer Terri F. that left a review below, I witnessed how shitty she was treated. So much so it ruined my night. I then felt so bad, and I should of spoken up and stood up for her. I love my cigars, but this lady made it a crappy environment. I hope the partners of Occidental Cigar Club addresses this matter!
author: Shane N.

description: We stopped in here on Sunday for my birthday just to check the place out, let the bf enjoy a cigar and myself a drink. While he was smoking the cigar (that he bought from this place of horrible business), his mother FaceTimed me to wish me a happy birthday and immediately this rude woman bartender storms over and yells at me to turn my phone down. I obliged and turned my volume down. I wasn't able to hear her so I had to let her go. We were going to order some drinks, but then my bf said no because she was rude to me and that we can just go. I told him no, we can stay so that he can finish the cigar. She then walked over and told me that there's a $10 charge since I wasn't buying a cigar, but she'll "let me slide this time". That was enough for my bf. He immediately cut his cigar and we left. She has terrible customer service and we know a lot of cigar smokers in which we will NEVER recommend this place to!
author: Ida L.

description:
Yvette Cervantes absolutely ruins this cigar bar. STAY AWAY

I have never been so offended in any public bar/restaurant in my life. I must provide that I have frequented this cigar bar a few times, without Yvette working, and I had a great time when Thomas is tending the bar. Great guy.

Alright, back to the bad and there is a ton of it. I stopped into Occidental to have a cigar one day after work. (Yvette works on Mondays and Tuesdays....DO NOT VISIT ON THESE DAYS). I sat at the bar and waited to be served. Whatever Yvette was doing on her phone was much more important to her than even pretending to care to provide any type of reasonable service. After she shuffled over to me, being obscenely disgusted that someone was at her bar, she served me. After having a sip or two, two regulars came into the bar. Let me preface this next statement by acknowledging that I understand how 'regulars' work at a cigar bar.

With that out of the way, Yvette looked at me and said "You need to move and sit in the seat behind you."

I couldn't believe she said this to me. I have never been so appalled by someone that has no right to have any type of arrogance towards another person.

This isn't the first time that I have experienced or seen her wrath.

Here's the deal. She's part-owner of the place. She thinks she can do what she wants, and she does, and it has no negative consequences on the bar. I feel awful for the other owners that they must tolerate her actions and bring-down what could be a decent cigar bar.

Yvette knows that there are no other locations to smoke cigars in the city. Therefore, she treats the patrons however she desires. However, if you are one of Yvette's friends, you're in for a treat! You're actually treated like a human being.

If you want better service. Go visit her sister that works at the strip club down the street.
author: Jared P.

description: Love this place downtown ‼ Head there for nice people and maybe a new friend or two. Share a stick and have the owner pair it with a great rum.
author: D E B.

description:
I've visited several bars in the surrounding area that held a certain aura in their establishment meaning the crowd was either one race or a mixture AND NEVER have I been treated in such a manner as we were at this place. I came to this "bar" on my birthday, to enjoy a nice cigar, have a drink and converse with a good friend. HOWEVER!! As soon as we sat at the bar, we were greeted with the upmost disrespect by the "woman" bartender (and i use woman loosely). Napkins were tossed to us on the bar and not in a welcoming bar way. Told that the cutters are behind her at the bar when asked for them. Then took our drinks away after I asked her if she was okay. Guess that touched a nerve, because then we were accused of "looking like we are going to cause trouble." And then states that she's part owner, so I guess that make it okay to be a B**** to your customers. It doesn't by the way. Once I requested for my card back, she states "I don't want you guys to leave"... WTF!! LOL! 

To partners with this rude person, if you want to keep your business running...You may want to have a conversation with her and her attitude. 

To future customers, good luck!
author: Denise L.

description:
The Occidental is one of the last bastions  to imbibe in both cigars and booze within in the confines of a public meeting place. 

Gone are the likes of Sherlocks and Grants!...Sad Face.

I remember many years ago meeting the founder Curtis Post and thinking his idea to open such a place a nice idea.

It still is a great place with great people. 

Their selection of Whiskys are very good.

Service is nice.

You can bring in your own cigars provided you pay the $5 dollar cutting fee. Their own selection is good to!

Check it out!
author: David G.

description:
As comfortable as an heirloom leather couch that's been past down for generations. 
Complete with a bartender with genuine integrity, and a spirit collection as varied as my ex's multiple personalities. 
This place is simply as good as it gets. 
Bravo gentlemen!
author: Russell P.

description:
To the partners of the Occidental Cigar Club,
     After visiting your club for only a few minutes with plans to celebrate a friend's birthday, my friend and I had napkins tossed in our general direction with no greeting whatsoever as the bartender Yvette Cervantes, chatted up another patron. When she decided to take our order, she barked 'you know what you want?' My friend answered her, and she screamed WHAT? Then proceeded to talk over my friend repeating the order telling them to speak up. Yvette's general demeanor was rude AF but we tried to hang in there once we got our cocktails. She continued to get snippy when we asked for a cutter, snapping 'can't you see I am busy, get them yourself they are behind the bar!' Mind you they were in front of us initially before she moved them. My friend asked if she was OK since we had gotten this foul treatment from the moment we entered the bar but that seemed to really set her off even though we explained the question was not designed to be sarcastic but that it seemed like there was something wrong but she was not trying to hear that. 
I picked up one of her business cards that was clearly for the taking when Yvette decided that was grounds for her to snatch our cocktails and tell us we needed to leave the bar because 'she knew what was going to happen from me taking her card'. She claimed we were looking for trouble and she didn't like our energy. Mind you we were dressed nicely, came in quietly, and had run a tab. She then tells us she is an owner and could act anyway she pleased. I have never been treated so shitty unprovoked by anyone who wanted me to spend money in their establishment. Having worked with the public for over 25 yrs I cannot imagine treating a customer the way we were treated for absolutely no reason. This women needs some customer service training or a position somewhere other than customer facing. She clearly does not have the grace for it. 
Good luck.
author: Terri F.

description: Lady there would not serve me and said because I'm Black I don't belong. Tossed napkins at me like I'm an animal! Terrible! You would think in SF people would be diverse shame on her! I would never go back!!!!!!!
author: Dave A.

description:
Cigar bar in downtown San Francisco near many restaurants and shopping. The bar sells cigars which you can smoke inside the establishment.

Our bartender, Bob, was very friendly and knowledgeable. I enjoyed his Bosanova Pandora station.

The bar has many fine scotch selections as well as wine. The prices are high but the the cigars and liquor are quality.
author: Becky K.

description:
Small place, small selection of cigars but nonetheless I like the vibe. It's eclectic and drinks are always good. Place is clean and a place we frequent several
Times a year!
author: Lupita R.

description:
I've been to this cigar bar for about three years and I absolutely love it. It's a great place to smoke cigars without people rolling their eyes at you. What I also like is that they don't allow cigarettes. I know, that sounds contradictory, but cigarettes have a different smell than the boldness of cigars. 

My favorite bartender is Yvette. She plays great music and is hilarious but she is about her business. You respect her and she respects you. Come in, buy a drink and a cigar and you are all right. 

Great cigars, great cognac and great atmosphere.
author: Kaye S.

description:
I've always wanted to go to Occidental, but the timing has always been off. I'd be with people who didn't like cigars, but be close by. Or I'd be with people who loved cigars and be no where near the Financial district. Finally, the stars aligned and I made it to Occidental last Saturday, March 5th around 8pm.

It was a super rainy night, so there weren't that many people in the cigar club. The atmosphere was super chill. Our group of three managed to snag three seats at the end of the bar.

I'm not much of a cigar smoker, but the roommate loves cigars, so I always default to him when picking one. He wasn't with us, so I texted him the cigar menu. He suggested the Arturo fuente, My father, Padron and Rocky patel. Between the three of us, we ended up getting a Rocky patel and a smaller Padron. I don't know much about cigars, but I enjoyed the Rocky patel more.

Drinks wise, we got: Tomatin, highlands: 18 yr ($20); Glenmorangie, highland: extra rare 18 yr ($24); and Occidental cigar club's single barrel eagle rare ($15 per measure). I preferred the Glenmorangie over the Tomatin. It was a lot smoother. Although the Tomatin did pair well when smoking the Rocky patel.

When I checked into Occidental, I noted, "Scotch and cigars. The perfect combination." So true!
author: Elena N.

description:
I found this gem in San Francisco using my trusty "Where to Smoke" app.  A decent selection of libations and cigars, with a really good "community bar" feel.  The bar tender was very attentive and steered me to a very good tequila "Los Artes" - if you are a tequila fan, this is a must try.  

I will come back for sure on my next trip!
author: Chris W.

description:
The first time I was in this establishment, I met Jake. He was very ingratiating, kind and helpful. I spent half the day there and tried some new bourbons that I hadn't experienced before. With that great impression from Friday, I decided to return on Saturday. That was my mistake. On my Saturday return, I met the woman behind the bar who made it very clear that she was one of the owners of this establishment. She let everybody know she was back from vacation and had partied for two weeks in New York City. She was rude, unhelpful and had a generally negative demeanor. I asked her for the torch to relight my cigar and she informed me that I would have to get up walk around the bar and use it myself, when all she had to do was reach back and hand it to me. I've never been in a cigar bar anywhere in the world where that has happened. It is for this reason I will never return to this establishment. She does not know how to make new relationships and I feel sorry for her and her business partners.

Update - I've thought about my initial review and moved it up a star since I did enjoy myself the first time I was there with Jake.  However, if he's not there, well, you know.
author: Matt E.

description: It's always a pleasure stopping by for a cigar and glass of champagne. Their selection is pretty good and their cutting fee is reasonable--in case you want to enjoy your Cohiba's from Havana that you brought back last winter ;-). You'll certainly feel like a cool cat and revolutionary, so stop by!
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description: Great place to smoke. Can get a little crowded at rush hour. Great rum selection. Great staff as well. Yvette is a fantastic bartender.
author: Devin S.

description: I'm giving this place a 5 on my husband's behalf.  I don't smoke but my friend and I tagged along with our husband's.  Place wasn't to busy when we got there but did pick up a little but it had a "chill" atmosphere.  They had a good selection of cigars and good service.
author: Danyelle H.

description: Just another way that San Francisco is similar to, but oh so much better than Seattle. The Occidental Manhattan is like a Rye flavored hug. Smooth and lovely, served in a high ball, it's like candy for grown ups. Dark wood walls, tile floors and pre-season Football on the TV's. Perfect.
author: Melissa M.

description:
If you love an occasional great cigar they got you covered
If you want a great selection of single malt scotch they got you covered
If you love a good beer on tap they got you covered
Great service also!

I've been twice there now on Saturday afternoon of scotch drinking and cigars and they have been the most enjoyable afternoons I've had in SF
author: P.j. K.

description:
Would have loved to leave a good review, visited just before 6pm with a an older grey haired gentleman, very friendly knowledgeable bartender. Good experience thus far.

At 6pm a dark haired woman took over and, completely unprovoked was extremely rude to my friend. Tried to ignore the attitude and extreme rudeness and spend more time ( and money) at the establishment since cigar bars are few and far in between but she continued to be terribly rude and provide terrible service.  

We left and will never be back. 

To the owner: this individual is hurting your business. Shame to have someone like that as the face of your establishment.
author: Tigran J.

description:
This cigar bar is by far the best I've had in the city. The club offers a nice range of prestigious cigars that can be costly but totally worth it as well as huge amount of imported alcohol. The list goes on. This club is neighborhood friendly and is well known to San Franciscans.

I truly felt comfortable here. The seating is well spread out and the level of intimacy is spot on. There is also dim lighting which is a plus. Some men are talking politics, some sports, and some actually on their laptops talking business. It's pretty much diverse. 

The owner is kind and approachable. He makes you feel at home and also gives great advice on drinks to pair with whatever cigar. Today I had an Arture Fuente with Venezuelan rum that is rare. It was a sweet vanilla taste with my light and medium smoke cigar. Together it was perfect. My totally came to be $35! Not bad! especially with watching sports and catching up on my emails on my phone. 

I've got to come back for more. I want to start pairing different cigars with different kinds of alcohol. It's fun, inviting, and many options to choose from. I don't think theres another cigar joint like this in the city. I def recommend this spot!
author: Allister D.

description: We walked in here because we want to place were able to sit down have a small drink and smoke a d*** good cigar. Kurt greeted us with a smile a handshake and specialty signature service. The prices there a little high but that's because California taxes are extremely high on cigars. Plus its downtown in the business district so you're gonna pay a little bit more. Definitely worth the stop try it
author: Indianalan H.

description: If you would like to smoke a cigar and enjoy a beverage, be it a single malt, Japanese whiskey or beer this is your spot. The owners are knowledgeable, helpful and know when to be a part of the conversation and when not to intrude. I always meet interesting people at the Occidental. At the end of a long work day I can go alone and know I'll be taken care of, in a relaxed environment. If you are visiting you will be charmed at the selection of cigars and local colour. If you work close to the Occidental, as I do, you will know any day you need that "time" to yourself or perhaps a bit of enjoyable conversation while having a fine smoke, you are at home.
author: Blondie E.

description: Wouldn't recommend this place.... bartender is an angry woman with no knowledge of service. The worst place to smoke a cigar in San Francisco.
author: Carlos M.

description: Bartender was awesome. Just came in a couple hours ago(memorial day). My friend and I are novice smokers and her recommendation was fantastic. She's very knowledgeable!! Thanks!!!
author: Mike T.

description: You're welcome to bring your own cigars and I'd recommend it considering the seriously overpriced, limited inventory. Inside noise was well above average. Wasn't very smokey inside, that may have been due to the front door being propped open. Staff ignored me the first 5 mintues at the bar, I had to interrupt her ask to be helped. I'll try all the other cigar lounges in SF before I return.
author: Michael S.

description: Nice cigar bar, friendly service, nice decor. Decent selection of cigars, beers and spirits.
author: Tim C.

description:
This place is one of 2 places where you can smoke in SF area. 
Please expect SF and California taxes when purchasing cigars here. Alternatively, you are welcome to bring your own cigar for a $5 cutting fee.  Very good cigars to be had here for $20, and the better ones will be around $30.

Its a smallish kinda place, with seating for 20 max.  There aren't any lounging chairs, and you'll find what you typically see in a bar setting. There is a full bar with a lot of whiskies.

This is more of a bar than a cigar lounge.  It just happens that you can smoke here.
author: Luke T.

description: Love this place!  Visit every time I'm in the City!  Friendly atmosphere and always feel like I stepped back in time
author: Gregory D.

description:
Been an old standby for years...many years. Though I used to live in SF long before the place opened in 2001, I still travel there often and frequented the place regulatory particularity after the smoke ban a few years after.

The two older gentleman behind the, I assume owner operators, consistently treated me with respect over the years. As I know both my smokes and brown liquors, they were smart and concise with great suggestions. Service was intuitive and never pushy. Though I am usually in there with small groups, I did have many followers a few nights during Super Bowl week but no issues.

However, I was in there on a Monday night earlier this year and encountered a dark haired woman behind the bar. Slow night, seemingly regulars only. I had never seen her in there before. She was not friendly at all and very brief. That, in and of itself, was no problem as I was in there after a long day, alone, not looking to talk or socialize. Then, her attitude devolved beyond aloof toward disdain almost anger. No idea why. I was as quit and detached as she was, I just wanted my drink and a smoke. 

Me wanting to pay in cash rather than use a credit card seemed to irritate her. She took forever to take my order. Barked out her request for a $5 cigar cutting fee which I have NEVER been asked for in all my year's visiting. I get how those types of "charges" can be applied at the owner/operators discretion, but I was clearly being treated much differently by this woman compared to the two other guys I was familiar with. She did not service me at my table at all while I was there (again, small crowd), I emptied my own ashtray, not problem in isolation, but while she saw doing this, she never came back to bring me a clean one thought I was still smoking.

Ordinarily, I would have told her to F*&K OFF and left but, those spots are limited and I needed my after-work ritual which I was not going to let her ruin. So I stayed.

But that may be the end of a long run between and OCC. Whoever that was behind the bar that night cost the business money at the end of the day.
author: Ralph G.

description:
In town for a visit or business? This is the place for folks who want to smoke a fine cigar, sip a little bourbon and enjoy a laid back atmosphere. Had a Flor de Las Antillas with Blantons and then the bartender poured me a Southwell 12 yr.old.     
They play great jazz but not so loud you can't think, the bartenders are friendly and it's just the right size to not be too crowded. No snobs here, just a peaceful experience. Great job guys, you got it right on the mark!
author: James L.

description: Awesome place for a smoke in San Francisco.   The sticks are way too pricey in my opinion but the service was top notch and the scotch  collection is second to none. Must tty it out.
author: Michael M.

description:
My profile picture says it all...I do qualify to write this review.

Single malt whisky in my right hand, a nice Arturo Fuente in my left hand, my boys sitting around the table watching whatever game is on TV or just talking smack.  I like sitting in the table up front, where you can open the window and get some ventilation.

One of my favorite places to blow off some steam, but make sure you bring enough $$ with you  They carry top shelf smokes and drinks but hey...chilling out does have a price.
author: Ron L.

description: Great cigar lounge.  Excellent selection of cigars and liquor.  Owner/Bartender Yvette is knowledgeable, friendly and efficient -a real old school bartender.  The lounge also features a great diverse crowd as one would expect in San Francisco.  Yvette makes sure that all are welcome and well cared for.
author: Kenneth D.

description:
I've been here a few more times since my original review and I must say that Occidental stands up to my high praise. I've met great patrons there and the bartenders (owners) are happy to share samples or recipes with you.

I have told dozens of people about The Occidental Cigar Club and they have all visited the place when they were in San Francisco.
author: Bil M.

description:
Went back last night and had another great experience. I ordered a Bulleit bourbon and they were out, so I was poured the Eagle Rare that they distill in their own barrels! A treat!

Also had a Fuente and some great conversation at the bar.

Perfect way to end any day when you're in SF!
author: Peter I.

description: Extremely overpriced cigar selection. Bought a $4 cigar for $18 and wine selection is most expensive I have seen throughout San Francisco. Don't waste your time or money
author: Ryan S.

description: Love it here! Order a Davidoff  yes I'm a girl and I smoke cigars and love them! The drinks here are poured well and the bar tender is sweet.
author: Sara C.

description:
Amazing spot, best place for Cigars in the city. My home away from home!

Great scotch selection, great booze selection in general. 

Good beers on draft. 

Staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. And the regulars make this place what it is, a great cigar bar.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Nice selection with decent prices on high end cigars considering California taxes.  

Unlike my last visit, Friday night was energetic but not so noisy. So so ventilation, with front door open. Otherwise, basically a couple ceiling fans and an open front door. All bar stools, no sofas or lounge chairs. 

Bar tender does a good job for a one man band despite a large crowd. Good cocktails. The old fashioned could use more bitters and less sugar but the Manhattan was excellent. 

I'd say it's not really a cigar bar, but rather a bar with cigars. But, a good spot for San Fran as long as you are not expecting a quiet cigar and comfortable seating.

Big plus is that it is open on Saturday afternoons!  I came in again and it was peaceful. The bartender was great. Music was great. I think it was the Pandora David Bowie channel. They were out of the brandy I wanted and she gave me tastes of two high end brandies and a bas Armagnac. They have a great selection of whiskey, port, and cordials. Several very good wines from boutique vineyards. Small beer list but mostly local breweries. 

Came back again Sat night and it was very pleasant. Busy but nice, quiet crowd and still great service. 

Highly recommended place for a cigar in San Fran.
author: Chris S.

description:
Everything about this place screams "old boys network", while making me (neither one of the "old boys" or one of the "network") feel like I belong. I've been here twice while visiting from out of town. The first time (3 years ago) was so outstanding that when I met up with a friend who was also visiting, about 2 months ago, I knew we needed to make a stop here even though it was out of the way.

This is a good old fashioned cigar bar. No frills. Great cigars at a reasonable price. Great bourbon selection. Eagle Rare distilled just for them was a real stand out. Kurt was a fantastic bartender. Knowledgeable, friendly and attentive, in spite of the growing crowd as the night wore on. 

We thoroughly enjoyed our cigars and our visit. Looking forward to coming back again on my next trip to SF.
author: Colleen M.

description:
A superb place, fun people to enjoy cigar, a nice selection of non-Cuban cigars with quality whisky, beer and rum selection. 

Crew is well equipped with information on what they sell. 

Keep the good work guys!
author: Koray Kaan Ö.

description: Rude and nasty. I ASKED about 5 dollar cutting fee, if it was charged even if Im having a drink. I was nastly told it was the fee period. She then asked if i was staying. I walked out, place is a joke. Maybe 10 cigars to choose from, all double average cost.
author: Gary G.

description: This place is, in every respect, the best bar in the city. It's so perfect it belongs in the movies. I wouldn't change a thing.
author: Oliver K.

description: Can it be possible to a zero star review? We asked which cigar would you recommend for a mild smoke. The bartender responded with wtf do you mean. I have never felt so disrespected at any establishment!
author: Alan L.

description: Great location and excellent selection of cigars and whiskey. However, the bartender was unnecessarily rude with no provocation. I'm not sure what happened to make her day so bad but she took it out on the customers. We tried to avoid interacting with her but felt like she was looking to pick a fight. It was aggressive and I will not return.
author: Matt T.

description: Cigar prices here are just ridiculous. Drew Estate Liga Privada #9 at $36 - I can get this same cigar for $15 at my local cigar store. Besides the crazy cigar prices, you will find the place really small and crowded.
author: Inde A.

description: Simply amazing.  The bartender, i forget his name, but he made it such a comfortable experience.  I could t recommend this place anymore.
author: Rahul C.

description:
So my wife and I were in town hitting a few places and I convinced her that we should pop into this place. As everyone can see, the reviews seem good and I wanted to try one of their higher end cigars.

We find some parking and head in only to be confused by the fact there isn't anyone behind the bar. Someone who sounded cheerful enough said hello, but I wasn't sure who that was in the dark interior. My wife pointed out that I didn't seem to know what was up in the place and I pointed out to her that I hadn't been there before. This was apparently RIGHT BEHIND the person who works there, who ignored this statement.

My wife sits down at one of the small tables and waits patiently while I peruse the cigar selection, a VERY small cabinet humidor. The only thing that makes up for the small size of the humidor is the, admitted, quality of the sticks. I am not sure if they are kept well, as things went further downhill from there.

After I decide on what cigar I want, I looked around for a bartender/tobacconist to assist me. No one appears, no one behind the bar. I look over at the end of the bar and notice someone folding something and assume that they work there. I migrate my way over to their area of the bar and they tell me, "I am doing something right now, the cigars are at the end of the bar. I will be with you when I have a second." 

As far as I could tell, all she was doing was folding stuff and chatting with someone. No money was exchanging hands, drinks being served, cigars being cut, and so on. 

As it appeared that she was too busy to serve us, we decided to leave and not spend any money in this establishment. 

Honestly, I wouldn't recommend this club to anyone.
author: Jon F.

description: Small but decent selection of draft beers, intimate place but usually plenty of seats before 6. Some pretentiousness but overall a good crowd. Service is friendly and attentive, and they know the proper position of a toilet seat. Enough good smoke in the air that you can just grab a beer, bogart your smoke "secondhand" and get the experience. $5 cutting fee is a bummer but such is life.
author: T J.

description: This place is crowed but chill ....m great cigar selection good spirits. Great bar lounge .... if you l8ve a good smoke and a good scotch come here .... often
author: George M.

description: Good spot to grab a stick and a scotch.   Pretty good selection of scotches and bourbons.  I was looking for a place to watch the game and smoke, and this was a good place to do it.  4 stars because there isn't much room to sit if it's busy.  Also, they charge a $5 cutting fee if you bring a cigar they don't carry even if you buy a drink.  But it's a cool place.  I was in from Fort Lauderdale and I'm used to more space and no cutting fees.  Other than that, it's a good place.  I'd come back for sure.
author: Terry B.

description: I consider The Occidental to be a staple of downtown San Francisco. When it comes to cigar selection, atmosphere, the friendly and knowledgeable owner/bartender, and great selection of whiskey, The Occidental is about as good as it gets. There's really no sense in belaboring the point... you need to try this place.
author: Joshua R.

description:
My girlfriend and I went San Francisco for the weekend and searched high and low for a nice cigar lounge to relax. Google led us to this heaven of a place we were looking for. The owner was so cool and down to earth and we hung out there for hours. Cigars are little on the pricey side but top rated cigars is only what they carry. If you bring your own cigars there is a $5 cutting fee for each cigar you smoke that you've brought,but the hospitality is an "A+ and it makes you want to patronize the cigars they carry and the vast selection alcohol they carry. It's one of the few if only place in Downtown  San Francisco that you can smoke in doors. 
I promise you I'll be back!
author: Darren H.

description:
After getting my hands on some Cuban cigars while I was in San Francisco I was looking for a legit place to go smoke and have a real Cigar experience. Out hotel was close to union square and when I looked up places luckily I found this place. Can't lie it was a great place to have a cigar and taste some quality rum or whiskey. 
We really enjoyed the atmosphere in this place. Guy behind the counter is not much of a talker but he assisted us to get a good match of a drink for the Cuban cigar we had. 
A great way to end a night !
author: Mayura D.

description: Do not smoke there they charge 5 dollar per cigar. They are also rude and disrespectful
author: Fahad A.

description:
This place is hands down the best cigar lounge I have ever been to. Kurt is the man. I don't really know what else to say. Cigar prices are more than fair and the drink selection is top tier. If you come here, you won't want to leave. If you treat him with respect, he more than reciprocates. I've been to all the cigar shops in the la/OC area, and this place takes the cake. 

Fair prices, great selection, and impeccable service; what more could you ask for?

Thanks Occidental! I can safely say I've found my go to spot in the Bay Area!
author: Ben P.

description: I can't believe the arrogance and down right hostel behavior of the dark haired woman that works behind the bar. She says she owns the place, if she does she needs to stay in back and never get behind the bar!!  What a pathetically unhappy person!!!  If you are thinking you're walking into a warm, neighborhood, cigar lounge, think again!! This woman is really a mean person and threatens to throw you out like she's drawing a gun. I've even been there before, paid significantly more for a cigar, and have had a wonderful time chatting it up with another gentleman behind the bar, but this person has now run me off!! She is a total Bitch and has no understanding of how to treat a patron. There are a few other options in the area, so don't subject yourself to such rude, unappreciated treatment. Horrible and uncalled for situation that will never be repeated. Move on and do let this toxic bitch ruin your smoke.
author: Terry S.

description: The owner was nice and knowledgeable but I found him to be a little pretentious as he doesn't allow any infused cigars. I really enjoy a sweeter cigar so I won't be visiting again. I bought a $20 glass of wine and really enjoyed it but the pour was very small.
author: Mia W.

description: So, I walking in last night to have a smoke and a drink.  I met a very nice couple and had a conversation with them.  During the conversation, they told me that the bartender told them that they don't allow people to smoke "Black and Milds" in the bar.  Now this couple had premium cigars in his holder.  I was very surprised that the bartender would say something like that.  I normally go there on a Sunday night and the bartender on that night is very knowledgeable and has a good personality, but this guy was a jerk for saying something like that to some very nice people from out of town!  It was very ignorant!
author: Renaldo W.

description: Great selection of cigars and whiskey. Very knowledgeable bartender. Will definitely come back on my next trip to Frisco.
author: Dan K.

description: Contrary to the positive reviews for this place I didn't enjoy myself here. This place needs a much better ventilation system than the one they have here as the place just left me gasping due to overcrowding. Decent selection of beer and liquors. The cigars on offer cover a decent range though we brought our own and didn't mind paying the 5$ cutting fee. I did revisit and with a light crowd the place was bearable.
author: Elvis A.

description: Decent selection but a little over priced. If you are fortunate enough to get a bar stool enjoy the crowd, the game and the people watching. The staff seems to be very attentive to your needs and likes. I will revisit when I am back in the City.
author: Dustin G.

description: Great little place.  Pretty busy. Good selection of sticks - somewhat pricier than expected - but a thoroughly enjoyable experience.  Great selection of drinks.  All beers are local (this is good and bad!). Highly recommend.  Very informative bartender.  Only thing missing was a few more seats and a patio!
author: Bryce C.

description:
What Marc C. from West Hollywood isn't telling you is that he came in with some friends, sat in a corner, didn't buy any drinks or cigars, and got butt-hurt when they got kicked out for not buying anything. THEN instead of just going somewhere else, he came back and started silently taking pictures from the doorway.

I know this. I was there. I saw it all go down.

The reality is that Occidental is a relaxed, unpretentious place to stop by after work for a cigar and a stiff drink with some very friendly actual-locals... Just don't be a Dick... or a Marc C.
author: Nick S.

description: Fantastic cigar bar... unpretentious, friendly,  great service. Visiting from Florida, Yvette made me feel right at home. I'll be back! Great selection of good cigars, scotch, and beers.
author: Joseph P.

description: Great easy going cigar bar.  Plenty of seating and it's a very fun, relaxed vibe.  Love coming here every time I'm in town.
author: Jonathan C.

description: 0 stars if possible! This place was horrible. The worst customer service ever. The woman working was extremely rude from the moment we walked in, it was like she didn't want business. We have had great experiences in the past here, but after my most recent, we will never be back. I have never felt more unwelcome when walking into a place as she made us feel. She claimed to be the owner, I certainly hope she's not, because as a business owner, I would NEVER treat customers the way she treated our party. Very DISAPPOINTED. I would not recommend this place to anyone!!
author: Kay A.

description: Best place to have a smoke, drink a classy drink, hang out with an menagerie of all types of people, and some awesome owners! This place is practically a second home for me and my husband.
author: debra l.

description:
Occidental can be fairly hit or miss with the crowds; it is a cigar lounge (you can smoke cigarettes as well inside), so you have to appreciate that smoky atmosphere. That being said, this bar has some of the best whisky, scotch, bourbon, and cognac you can find (which you can hardly ever buy from an importer). The bartender/owners have been there forever, and as a consequence becoming a regular is totally an option. They keep your spirit of choice filled without question and have spot-on recommendations. The older jovial crowd can also be found here, so even while you're young you can pop in for some old-fashioned advice and soak in the olden days. Ask for a single barrel brandy or possibly their house bourbon barreled stout! Cheers! 

(P.S. Read the menu, it has character to boot)
author: Thom And Vicky H.

description:
I stopped by this cigar bar while in SF last month. The owner was behind the bar. Place was fairly packed, 12 or so people which is almost full considering its small size. They have a small humidor next to the bar. Limited choices and overpriced. I'd recommend bringing your own sticks. 

The owner had some friends at one end of the bar she was providing with great service. She was nice to me and the others but something really rubbed me wrong. She was serving a foursome of Russian foreigners several shots. She then poured some back into different shot glasses and gave them to her friends. How do you over pour a shot glass? Full is full. Apparently, not so here. Shots are 3/4 shots. It was also fishy that she did this while then patrons backs were turned. They saw full glasses, turned around, and took their 3/4 full glasses to their table. 

This isn't good business. I won't be back. Owner needs to learn how to treat people properly. She bragged about her number of years being a bartender. Well that's splendid but it doesn't mean you're gracious. Shocked she did this right in front of me, a total stranger. 

I found this place as a recommendation in Cigar & Spirits Magazine. I'll have to keep looking for better places to have a cigar and drink in town. Cheers.
author: Jordan M.

description:
Yvette just runs a damn good business. 

I cant say enough about this place. I used to go all the time but recently my schedule has not permitted a frequent visits. Even though there may be patrons that go more than i do Yvette always remembers me and makes me feel right at home. 

Dont let the size of the lounge fool you, there is a great selection of cigars accompanied by an equally impressive stock of scotch, bourbon, and whiskey. This is not your chic modern cigar lounge, this is the old school leather wrapped, scotch neat, take your time and converse sort of cigar lounge. Always a great pour which is something you rarely see these days. you definitely get your money's worth.

One of the things i love most is there is RARELY any drama. There are so many places with drama these days. I can always go here and have a peace of mind and relax. The patrons are very friendly. i dont think i have ever gone in and not had a conversation with at least 1 person and for less than 15 minutes. (of course you could keep to yourself and no one would bug you but wheres the fun in that). 


If youre looking for that old school cigar lounge feel, a superb scotch & cigar pairing, as well as a chill environment to enjoy those in, then make the time everytime to stop in.
author: Derek F.

description: If you want to have a cigar and a drink this is the best and only public bar you can go to!  It's a really cool spot to have a drink and cigar though.  Great Alcohol and cigar selection worth stopping by and checking out!
author: Ray F.

description:
Great little cigar bar and a welcome oasis for those traveling from places that have less stringent smoking laws. 

Their liquor selection was deep for their miniscule footprint and the bartendar was a great sassy lady who helped us get set up with a stick and a cocktail very promptly.

There's a $5 cutting fee for cigars brought in from outside FYI. Their selection of cigars available in the bar were very well versed. All the regulars were present such as Rockay Patel, Arturo Fuente, Romeo Y Julieta, etc. and the prices were in line with most cigar stores. 

Looking to smoke a cigar inside a bar in the middle of downtown San Francisco? This is your place.
author: Drew K.

description:
In our third year of visiting what we thought was a solid  establishment, we were shamed - no other word - after spending $600 per visit - for reasons beyond explanation?

We are here with a globally renowned engineer who doesn't drink and we're grandstanded at 6 pm.

State of shock is an understatement.

Occidental - never again.   Enjoying ourselves RS warmly next door!

JAH
author: Donald D.

description: This review is for my experience yesterday only. I have been before and been very happy. This is a cool spot and the last time we were in ( with a group of about 8) we were treated very well. Served quickly, treated nicely, got lots of helpful answers to our questions ( we are pretty knowledgeable about our smokes and drink so we can tell the bulls**t from the good) this time completely different. It was a quiet Saturday afternoon, not too many people in the place. Again we had a group of 8 celebrating a birthday and from the get go the dark haired woman behind the bar was beyond rude. No greeting just " I'm going to need to see your ID" from one in our party.  She was not helpful regarding questions about wine or beer, just snotty and condescending. As we're ordering drinks she felt the need to tell us there was no cigarette smoking allowed while she was working, gives her a headache. WTF we hadn't started to smoke nor did we ask. The birthday boy had now been waiting all this time for her to open the humidor. He mentioned out loud out how rude she'd been by making him wait even after we told her to take care of that before our drinks and mentioned she was being a b, after some snotty retort from her. Needless to say we sucked our drinks down and moved on. This is a person who should not be in a customer service position. Greet your customers, smile, know your product, it's not that hard.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Great place to have a nice cigar and some good whisky.  It is a bit cramped and crowded and the ventilation could be better.  Overall it was a good place to go and the owner/bartender was nice plus very welcoming.

I'll have to go again in the day time when there is less people.

Update: Great during the day!
author: Hara K.

description:
First off, I don't smoke.  At all.

However, I love this place!  Came in with some colleagues, enjoyed the best Old Fashioned I've had in SF so far.  The guys loved the cigars too.

Will definitely be back!
author: Chris I.

description:
We were excited to try this cigar bar, especially considering there are only a few of them in the area. We walked in and were greeted by an unattended bar; however, a patron warmly approached us and told us that the bartender had to step out and would be back shortly. About 10 minutes later, the bartender shows up and asks us what we'd like to drink. In the middle of the conversation, another patron walks up to the bar and she quickly dismisses our conversation and leaves us in mid-convo. 

While she's on the other end of the bar, the patron who approached us earlier asks her if she's tended to us and the bartender replies "They don't even know what they want yet." When I heard that I responded by saying we've been ready to order and she says "oh - well I'll come over once I'm done." 

After a few more minutes she comes over and asks us what we want to drink. My friend makes it a point to address the fact that she walked off while we were still trying to order and she immediately gets defensive and tells us how this is an owner-operated bar and that she had an errand to run and is understaffed but she's here now - all with jarring attitude and piercing eyes. My friend responds and says "considering that this is an owner-operated bar, you'd think that customers would be more appreciated." 

She finally chills the freak out and comes to her senses and pours us a glass of their Angel's Envy Occidental Bourbon (they ran out of their signature Blanton's) and proceeds to grab a Padron Aniversario 1926 cigar for my friend. The bourbon is smoother than your normal Angel's Envy, and the cigar was good as expected (not dry or poorly kept). The bartender actually makes up for our little "tiff" earlier and becomes more welcoming and attentive, checking on us and recommending bourbons (I tried the Black Maple Hill compared to the Balcones Baby Blue - the former had a lot of bite from beginning to end; the Balcones was much smoother). 

Overall, the bar has a good bourbon and scotch selection as well as a decent selection of cigars to choose from. The ambience is dark, smoky, classy - like something you'd familiarize with the 60s. However, it's become quickly apparent that locals are definitely more welcome and more tended to than out-of-towners.
author: Kimsua L.

description: Very cool place. Loved their cigar knowledge and selection. Also can't complain with the selection of spirits to compliment the cigars
author: Jonathan C.

description: When we entered we were underwhelmed by the layout. There are no comfortable sitting areas typical to a cigar bar and it is a very cramped and poorly ventilated space. We decided to give it a go and grabbed the two open stools, only for the bartender to be immediately rude to us and yell at us for having outside drinks (water bottles). She did not tell us about the policy before she started raising her voice and acting annoyed. She then said we could finish them or toss them and then started making a grabby motion with her palm while going "now, now" while I was finishing mine. We handed them over to be trashed and then immediately left. This place felt like the cigars were a schtick and the atmosphere would be horrible if you have ever been to a decent cigar bar with a semblance of service.
author: Joshua M.

description:
The only legally recognized bar in all of SF where you can smoke cigars while you enjoy an old fashioned, Bomore, Balvenie, Glenmorangie, or my all time favorite, the McAllan 25. Sure, it's a $100 a pour, (NOT just because its the FiDi, but its quality at its finest) but to enjoy that sip for sip, and w/ your favorite cigar in the other hand, well I couldn't think of a better marriage.

The staff is very knowledgeable in their whiskeys, and even more so in their cigar selections; very fitting!  My favorite here is Yvette, she's a super smart cigar and whiskey connoisseur who is patient, willing, and able to find you the perfect drink to accompany your cigar.  

It's an old school bar w/ new school flair.  The ventilation is pretty well configured with large overhead fans whirring atop you at about every ten feet or so.  There are charging cables galore at the end of the main bar for all your phone and accessory needs.  There are cigar cutters, lighters, matches, and really anything you need right at your fingertips at the bar.

You cannot order directly from the bar; however if you're nice, the staff will give you a stack of recommendations from the eateries on the block and they will deliver it straight to your seat.  I love that this cigar bar is conveniently located within spitting distance of our office.  It really is a great place to just unwind when you need a few minutes to get away and just relax so you can get back to grinding it out. Even more so, after a long day when you can sit back and relax while the sweet stenches of the Macanudos and Drew Estate Kubas fill your lungs with finely rolled tobacco accented in herbs and spices.

ENVIRONMENT: Not for the breathing impaired.  This IS a CIGAR BAR!
DRINKS: Not too shabby depending on strength and age of your drink.  I only order one.  Anyone who knows me knows exactly what.

EATS: Great selection up and down the block of fingerfoods to meals hand delivered to you at the bar.

OVERALL: Love it!
author: Myke Y.

description: A relaxing spot for a nice cigar and aperitif.  Peruse through the menu for some clever quips from great historical figures.
author: Cat D.

description: best cigar lounge in all SF.  best selection of whisky and very friendly.
author: Dan M.

description:
This is the epitome of what a bar should be:  friendly bartender (especially Yvette) and fellow patrons, broad selection of drinks and a great selection of cigars which are humidified properly and reasonably marked up.  I can't say enough good things about this place as there isn't anything I would change even if I could.

I used to drop by here with relative frequency but due to an incident with an insanely rude bartender, stopped coming the last few years, it's good to know and see that things have changed for it to reach its full potential!

In times where the authenticity of SF gets questioned with how much the city has changed, it's nice to come to a place like this which maintains proper character.
author: Ryan C.

description: Thank you Yvette!!  Great selection of both scotch and cigars and the recommendations were perfecto!!
author: Brian M.

description:
Was in from out of town and was looking for a chill place to have a cigar. Not only did i have a great cigar but they have an excellent selection of scotch, bourbon, rum and tequila!!! 

Yvette was tending the bar and provided great service and knowledge about the cigars in the humidor and the spirits in the bar. Definitely an awesome spot for a weekend smoke. I will definitely be back whenever im in town.
author: Jordan S.

description:
This place had a cool bar vibe to it, but it was extremely 'smokey'. They had two humidors with a decent selection of the regulars, including Padron, Perdomo, and Fuente to name a few. You can grab a seat at the bar or at some tables, but it's quite small and the ventilation wasn't great.

If you're needing a place to smoke and you can do it outdoors, then the Cigar Bar & Grill might be a better spot, but this place was decent.
author: David M.

description:
The Occidental Cigar Club forced me to leave this review! They're outstanding selection and knowledge made my vacation to SF worth the whole trip. 

I'm planning another vacation in November and the biggest reason is OCC. Jason knew exactly what I would like based on what I told him.

Truly 5 stars!
author: Ebon T.

description: My husband and I came home for a visit and decides to hit up this cigar club after reading a bunch of positive yelp reviews. We we're not disappointed. We decided to splurge and get the 21 year aged red breast whisky and 2 cigars. Our total was around 150 with tip, but it was worth it! Just wish we lived closer because this would become a regular spot for us.
author: Kimberly R.

description: Fantastic experience. Came to San Fran in vacation and had a hard time finding a cigar bar downtown. Discovered this place and absolutely loved it. It's not a big place, so seating is somewhat limited. But the selection of scotch and knowledge of the proprietor stands out to me. Can't wait to come back!
author: Justin P.

description: This place is awesome. I was planning a trip for my hubby and I, and we are big fans of cigars and scotch. WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED. Not only was the service impeccable, but we had such a  great time. Bring your own cigar.. Only a $5 cutting fee. We will be back for sure. A true diamond in the rough
author: Miranda P.

description:
Finished enjoying dinner and aren't ready to call it a night? The Occidental Cigar Club is open until 1am seven nights a week! The OCC is an awesome place to sip through an extensive list of scotch and whiskey while smoking a quality cigar. 

Connoisseurs, amateurs, and non-smokers are all welcome. Bubba, Curtis, and the other owners are all knowledgeable and can guide you through a wonderful evening of drinking and smoking. 

Definitely worth a stop if you want to enjoy a cigar in SF.
author: Ian C.

description: I have always wanted to go here on my many visits to San Francisco and glad I finally did last month. Really neat to see the mix of men, women, ages, and diverse clientele. Big fan of Scotch and Bourbon, and they have a fantastic selection. Service was outstanding, if the bartender was not the owner, he sure should be.
author: Scott a.

description: Great for newbies and self-proclaimed afficianados. Bartenders who know their stuff, but dont give an attitude if you don't know yours. Very cool place to enjoy a stogie and a scotch.
author: Lucy V.

description:
A haven in San Francisco where you can enjoy fine (really fine!) spirits while enjoy a stogie.  Came here with my buddy to unwind from a long week and found their whiskey menu immediately appetizing, particularly their Japanese whiskey selections. We both went with the Yamakazi 12 year and were no disappointed!  Paired with an Oliva I was happy as can be.

This is a spa for those looking to relish in their sins, a smoke and a drink, at a slower pace than your usual bar.  Expect great conversation with your bar neighbors and your bar tender.

Beware before lighting anything other than a cigar here, ASK the bartender if they mind cigarettes/pipes before you light it.  It was apparent to us that it depends who is working that night what is allowed.  That somewhat sketchy rule between owners/bartenders results in a -1 star.
author: Kris L.

description:
Great place to hangout and grab a few drinks and smoke a cigar. I am not a cigar smoker but because everyone here is friendly and great atmosphere, I definitely give this place good ratings. Jake is a great bartender!!

They also have a cute outdoor restaurant next door if you are hungry.
author: Jen S.

description: I love this place the man i loved very much you to,take me there , try the ahe tuna , this place. Is old world class please. PLEASE. PLEASE. Dont change one thing ! Philip Kallthoff , i will love you forever lela ,if anyone nos what ever happen to his kids xoxoxo u have my heart .....and so dose this place its truely. Like going back in time .........
author: Lela D.

description:
I went here for a drink with a co-worker. They have a good selection of whisky and cigars.  
The staff was friendly and eager to advice you on whats new and interesting. Plus any place were you can smoke a cigar and have a drink in lefty SF is a 5 star place.
author: Bob b.

description: Not what I expected at all. Not really sure why I had something in mind for the place but its different than my spot up north.  I try and find cigar bars, lounges, or whatever when I go places and this spot is well thought of.  It's a club which is cool so technically not a bar do your can smoke there.  Tiny little place in the financial district of SF.  4-5 small stand up type tables, full bar, and two medium sized humidors.  Fairly well stocked with a bit of the regular sticks and a few exotics.  I went macanudo gold label robusto and 2 measures of rum.  Pirate life for sure, pirates are pretty sick right.  Cigar smoked perfectly maybe 90 min smoke from 11:30 to 1am or so.  Rum was spicy with a bit of a bite at the end.  Packed in there late at night.  Like most cigar joints tons of regulars .  Nice spot, good smokes.  I liked it.
author: Ron C.

description:
Classic old "joint", a true man's man cigar and cocktail lounge (more like a corner bar that your grandfather went to rather than a "lounge"!)
Prices are fair, the scotch selection was deep, and the bathroom was clean. $5 cutting fee is reasonable as well.
I will be back whenever I am in town!
author: Jim C.

description:
Um awesome sauce. My bf and I ventured here post birthday dinner. Why not top an amazing meal with a celebratory cigar? We walked the 5-8 blocks from BIX and entered in a small bar, filled with cigar smoke and older gentlemen.  I tell my man to go pick out 2 of the finest cigars (to be honest, I never have had my own cigar before) and I order us 2 aged scotches. We settle by the window. I come back from the bathroom and my bf has made friends with a great chap from Toronto. We all start hamming it up and next thing you know shots of Prevette (spelling, actually name?). Prevette is this Jager type shot that is pretty nasty, similar to Jager, but, people drink lots of and is supposedly "huge" in San Fran.  We knock a few of those back. At this point we got a good little crew, a guy that runs a winery up north and my bf's homie from college. No ladies.

I start dancin'. That happens to me... a lot. I got moves too. But, back to the story, I am the only lady in this bar at this point so, I am conjuring up some attention. I declare that its this handsome guys 30th bday (pointing to my bf) and all these gentleman (about 6 suited up guys post 40) all stand up and raise their glasses and toast my bf and tell him he's an old fuck and come over and pat him on the back and start talkin' shit.  It was hilarious. It was fun. It was random. It was overall a great time that probably wouldn't of happened anywhere but this place. No ladies.

We closed the place down to me twirling all around the bar post hours with my bf and his friend, jamming out hard to the music.  The bartender/owner who was an amazing sport through this whole evening with my drunken shenanigans was a delight, a pure delight. Schmokin' stoges with his customers and offering up a drink to those in need. 

The next morning I was hungover and my clothes reeked like cigar smoke, my tokens from the night prior. I had to catch my flight back to NYC but, it was a good flight and definitely had a few giggles to myself thinking about the fun evening prior.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I misunderstood what happened that evening. I take back my original post. All good at Occidental. Love this place. Curt is so knowledgeable about everything in his establishment. Go here!
author: William S.

description: Great place to enjoy a drink and cigar. The only downside is I had to throw my clothes away, I couldn't get the smoke smell out of them. Next time I go I'm going to where some trashy clothes and leave them at the hotel. I'm a huge fan though!
author: Michael A.

description: Stoked that we stumbled on this place after lunch nearby. Crowd was mostly made up of well dressed, after work businessmen casually smoking cigars and enjoying a drink. Curtis, who I believe is the owner, was super welcoming to my wife and I, and helped me find a good smoke (cigars kept in great shape). Large single malt scotch selection, and good beers on tap as well. He invited us to try a taste of some rye whiskey from Sonoma I believe, which we liked. The place is small, and the ventilation could be better, but I absolutely felt at home and enjoyed the atmosphere.
author: Ryan M.

description: Curt's the man, and the solid cigar selection is overshadowed only by the amazing choice of whiskeys and rums. Whenever I'm in town, I make it a point to visit. What a great establishment.  Try the Rocky Decade with the Ron Zacapa 23 yr.
author: Sal F.

description: The people here are rude!!!  I went to the bathroom, covered my drink as one should , when I came back my seat was taken by some ignorant dude and the guy behind the cigar bar didn't say a thing!! I will not be coming back!!
author: Ruhi L.

description:
Randomly stumbled into this place the other night. I give the bartender/owner five starts for service. My two friends and I were all new to cigar smoking and there were no dumb questions. We were there on a Saturday night and while the place is small it still felt very comfortable and the ambiance was great. Some of the regulars noted it can get more crowded when there are conventions in town. Again the ambiance was great and just what you would expect from a cigar club. While we were picking out our cigars a few of the other patrons chimed in and offered their suggestions. Ended up talking with them for over two hours and again there were no dumb questions and no judgment passed at us being new and not being regulars. The only reason I struggled to give this place five starts were the drinks. The drinks themselves were delicious but a little pricey. I understand its SF and this place is filling a niche market but still just a little too steep on the price.

All in all I highly recommend this place and will be back!
author: Andy D.

description:
One of the very few, if not only places you can smoke a cigar and drink a cocktail indoors. The Friday night crowd was casual and the spot was crowded. No lack of activity here. Plenty of spirits to choose from including one of my favorites, Booker's. They have a limited selection of cigars but as long as your drinking, they don't mind if you smoke one or two of your own. If you're not a smoker, probably gonna be a little light headed on a crowded night. You can order in some food from one of many nearby places and have it delivered to you inside. A good time! 
(Btw, the yelp algorithm, 1 star!)
author: Ken H.

description: Cigar selection is small. Good voice of beer and cognac. The service was ok. Bartender was fast but not polite. I would however go back and try again.
author: Terry S.

description:
I love this place!

It's nice because it has a Financial District type of feel.  It's nice inside, but comfortable and not pretentious.  A long bar with bar seating, and some tables near the entrance.  They have a great selection of beer, wine, cocktails, and liquor.  The cigar selection is not as vast as other places, and they do charge a premium for their cigars, but you're paying for the opportunity to relax in a nice bar and to be able to drink as well (which very few cigar lounges offer).

Most importantly...Fast and Friendly service at the bar!
author: Jean M.

description: Very nice selection of cigars and good bar. We Uber'd in and out just in time for one cigar and one martini. Good ventilation!
author: Vince R.

description: Not a big selection of cigars and not a lounge.  Great vibe and customer mix.  Would absolutely recommend for a night out with friends to grab a good drink and have a stoogie.
author: Ralph E.

description: First and last time! Bar tender Yvette had it in for me for some reason. She was so rude!!! I told her I'd like my cigar cut small and she told me, "i know how to cut". I asked for a beer and i mispronounced "dragooon" as "dragon" and she abruptly corrected me. I raised my hand to order another drink and she told me, "ah yea your gonna have to speak up, we don't to hand raising around here". My husband and i were dress down but you never know who your dealing with in the public but lets just say that company lost some future business... Too bad.
author: Dorian M.

description: First time at a cigar club, and I have to say that I had a really good time. Interesting crowd and not too packed on a Saturday night. It's probably the whole smoking-is-bad-for-you schtick. Did I also mention that I'm a runner who doesn't smoke? It's just about enjoying the atmosphere and kicking it with some friends, trying some new things. Bartender is nice, and there's a good selection of liquor for your cigar smoking. Beer selection isn't great, but judging by the limited size here, it's not that kind of place. Come check it out. You'll at least try something new. Car reeked of cigar smoke for a day. Classic.
author: Danny C.

description: I quite enjoyed this place during the couple of days I stayed in SF. It is close to Union Square and both the clientele and staff are to notch. It seemed to be a mix of locals and out of towners in a smallish but comfortable space. The selection of cigars is quite good and I found a few good Padrons. Very casual, enjoyable.
author: Hamad T.

description:
If it were up to me, cigars would be allowed in every bar and there'd be a pipe-smoking man on every corner. 

But as it is, with regulation forcing cigar smokers to hole up in little hideaways like it's prohibition all over again, The Occidental Cigar Club offers the very best alternative to real freedom. 

We stopped in last Friday night on our short trip to San Francisco. I'm far to much of a lady to have any interest in smoking cigars myself, but my long drawn-out love affair with the smell made me perfectly content to sit there all night by the window enveloped by the scent of Eddie's cigar. 

It's a cute little place that was busy all night without ever quite getting crowded. Four to five beers on tap and many reasonably priced cigars to choose from. The bartender is welcoming and friendly, making it seem like being there is more of a hobby than a job to him. There was a good mix of young and old, mostly male but some females throughout the night. The atmosphere is warm and relaxing, which slows down time and makes you fall in love with just being there. 

Life doesn't get better than this.
author: Cole C.

description: This is an excellent big city cigar bar filled with lots of what seems to be business people from DT San Fran.  Nice selection of premium cigars and excellent drinks Ina classic watering hole venue.  Perfect for a Friday afternoon after a busy week. Drinks were excellent, well made and the whole place clean and inviting.
author: Pete M.

description: 2nd time around, bar, service and cigars as great as last year. Add an awesome crowd, this place rocks. Smoking a very well kept Ashton VSG spellbound and drinking a lovely house exclusive whiskey. Fantastic place to enjoy a darn good smoke.
author: Mike J.

description: Well right off the bat know this is a BAR that you can smoke in. The cigar selection is a small single rack selection with WAY over priced and limited sticks. BUT, know you can bring your own cigars for a $5 cutting fee. This is a VERY locals place and they take a long time to warm up to outsiders. That being said, once they do warm up and you get a good drink and smoke in you, boom, it's a bastian of old world greatness in a liberal crybaby pond. Bottom line, bring your own smoke (I'd never pay that much per stick anywhere), appreciate the bar, the locals and enjoy a dying breed of a smoking bar.
author: Burro ..

description:
I cannot even being to explain the awesomeness that Occidental is...

- Cigar connoisseurs think this place is heaven, albeit a smokey one.
- Cigar amateurs think this is a good place to figure out what kind of a cigar lover you are
- Those of us who don't smoke but like the smell of them cigars find this place to be charming (beware though, if you have long hair, the cigar aroma becomes a stink that requires Head & Shoulders for it to be washed off)
- For those who enjoy a whiskey with their cigar, THIS is the place to be.

They have a range of cigars and the lady behind the bar (Yvette) is more than happy to help you figure out which cigar to pair with your drink or vice versa.
And for us non-whiskey drinkers, she can whip up something special for sure.

My husband and friends loved this place so much, that every cigar bar we decided to visit in San Diego last week was pale in comparison. 

We are future regulars :-)
author: Ranjani S.

description:
Where do I begin? It's one of the last bastions of indoor smoking, for starters. The ambience is calm and comfortable, lots of dark wood, marble counters, and cushiony stools. The hospitality is excellent: each and every one of the bartenders/owners is an expert at service, cigars, and booze.

My boyfriend and I come here at least once a week. Order a little dinner from one of the nearby restaurants and they'll have it delivered to you at the bar. I drink red wine and smoke cigarettes. My boy orders whiskey and fires up a cigar (he usually brings his from home). We're so happy. We watch the game or chat it up with whoever's around. This bar most always sports a blend of both locals and tourists... and a lot of returning tourists. 

It's our living room away from our living room. The Occidental is always classy, never fancy... just like us.
author: Angela K.

description: A decent cigar bar considering it's in the heart of downtown San Fran.  Limited seating.
author: Robert N.

description:
Yay!
