This is a much needed establishment.  The owner, the patrons, the ambiance, the scent, all are fantastic.
author: Lisa M.

description: The owner was so helpful and knowledgeable. We had an incredible time and the wine and bourbon pairings were great!
author: a c.

description: 1 of only a few places left in the city to stop and relax with a cigar.  Humidor is small, but they have a few decent selections.  I always carry around my own cigars, but I also make sure I buy a few smokes from every cigar shop / cigar bar that I stop in to.  Decent selection of booze -  small, but cozy location.  Great place to relax with a cigar!
author: Troy L.

description:
I am a broke college student who has been living with the same wardrobe for the last few years. However, being born in '86 and having an extremely stylish mother who was my same size back in the day has it's benefits. I ended up raiding her closet before the S.O. and our two friends went out, so I wore knit leggings and a suede and leather knit sweater. Basically, it was the bomb. 

Outside of awesome fashion, something that came out of the 80's was a penchant for going wild. Since my idea of a wild night doesn't involve copious amounts of cocaine (like the 80's), I decided a cigar bar would be as far as I could go. The suggestion was made and we walked right in. 

Admittedly, I should have asked the bartender for a recommendation on a drink rather than just ordering four beers. I decided to get a vanilla cigar - COME ON - and smoked the rest of the night away while sipping on my beer. Not the most fantastic combination, but will do in a pinch when you've ingested enough alcohol to tranquilize an elephant (I'm convinced that in the 80's people drank beer to sober up). 

The S.O. ordered up a fat cigar, but his review of it was not so stellar. Oh well! Hey, I liked the place. There aren't many establishments that still allow smoking ANYWHERE, shit, even Paris got a stick up their ass about it. When you imagine a Parisienne, you think - "Beret. Striped shirt. Long, thin cigarette." How disappointing. 

I recommend coming here as a nightcap to going out on a special occasion. Word to the wise: If you decide to wear a 25 year old outfit in mint condition, be prepared to shell out major bucks to get Neiman Marcus to specially dry clean it, or you're going to get a mouthful of expletives when your mother asks how the outfits are doing (WHOOPS).
author: Jaime L.

description: Yvette is the most awesome Bartenress in all of SF. Did I mention you can smoke, inside- and whiskey.
author: Mark M.

description:
This place just oozes testosterone. The bar is dark, compact, boasts a enviable shelf of whisky that just calls to you.  Clouds of thick, luxurious smoke rise from their collection of choice cigars.  I'll be honest, this is one of the quietest bars I've ever been to.  On the particular aftetnoon I was there, it was mostly solitary patrons either reading, writing or contemplating life.  Basically getting their Hemmingway on.  
Not to say that women weren't welcome, there were definitely a few there, but there is something distinctly confident, masculine and mysterious about this bar, and it seems to rub off on those who enter.
author: Mike U.

description:
I've never smoked a cigar (cigarette, hookah, pot, weed, etc.) in my life.  I had a couple of friends from out of town and they were excited about smoking cigars so I obliged.  The place was quiet with a good amount of bar stools around (we were the loudest thing in the establishment).  I thought I would be annoyed with the smell and smoke but instead, I loved it.  It was a chill place with lots of alcohol and more importantly whiskey.  The boy got some whiskey for the guys, wine for me and a martini for my friend.  We spent an hour there and would've spent more if not for dinner.  

The bartender was helpful and the people there were really nice and easy to talk to.  It's one thing for the employees to be awesome but another thing for the other patrons to be equally as awesome; I believe it says something about the place.  Not sure I'll want to actually try a cigar the next time I visit but you can bet I'll return!
author: Lynn C.

description:
There are so few respites for smokers in SF. Occidental is small and slightly stodgy, albeit in an almost charming way, but it provides a unique and much needed service.
When you want to grab a scotch & cigar after work there's really no other place to go. Their cigar selection isn't spectacular, but their alcohol list is well-rounded and their prices are fair.
author: Max G.

description:
PROS:
- Sizable cigar collection kept in humidors
- Nice atmosphere
- Wide assortment of drink choices.
- Friendly owners
- Clean

CONS:
- Small Interior
- No food service, strictly stogies and booze

SIDE NOTE:
- Owner provided my friend and I a free scotch sample

OVERALL:
- I would come back, but probably not with a large group due to their limited seating/standing capacity. Also, I would be careful if coming here on a Friday or Saturday night, I would imagine it would be packed with customers.
author: Kevin N.

description:
I could not be happier that we stubbled upon this glorious place our first day visiting San Francisco. My husband and I were walking around trying to find a chill place to just hang out for the afternoon and we looked on yelp and found Occidental. We walked towards it and looked in. Its a smaller place, very comfortable looking, great selection of bourbon, humidors full of fine quality cigars, and the lovely Yvette sitting at the counter laughing that we had walked past one time and then promptly turned around and came in.

Cigar selection is finely curated, they are reasonably priced and high quality. The selection of bourbon, like I said, is vast and equally as high quality. The atmosphere varies depending on day of the week and time, but it is always fun and comfortable. The customers range from older gentlemen who have been coming here for years, to the overdressed hipster. You can get food delivered in from surrounding restaurants (and there is no lack of surrounding restaurants!), and you will definitely make new friends.

I would highly recommend venturing to the Occidental Cigar Club!
author: Renee R.

description: Wonderful, wonderful visit Saturday afternoon. Bartender is very knowledgable of her cigars and whiskey/scotch. She's also a lot of fun. Someone had mentioned the place wasn't as friendly to tourists as locals but I found that totally untrue. I regret I have to leave today - I'd love one more visit. Highly recommend for those who like a good cigar, good drink, no pretense.
author: Dan C.

description:
I don't hate this place, but... yes you can smoke and that's a plus, but as a cigar lounge it is very mediocre (trying to be polite and not call it crap).  Cigar selection limited, humidors disorganized and messy and sloppy, cigar selection is weak, lounge options non-existent.  

I'd call this place a dive bar with a few cheap cigar options in a convenient location.
author: Joe S.

description: Repeat all the good things said here. Also, can order from menus of several nearby restaurants and they will bring food right over! Great at lunch time as resturants all packed and no seating there but can sit here, have lunch with cigar and a great drink.
author: Donald O.

description: I don't smoke, but went here with a few friends. Had some drinks, chatted with the friendly bartender. It was nice.
author: Drew B.

description: We love this place - Yvette, Bubba, Thomas, Jake and Curtis - thanks for having such a great place. Always new people to meet, great scotch, bourbons, and rye, good cigars and love the music. We have really made great friends here! Hey Yvette - loved that Rock Hills Farm bourbon! Great Super Bowl party yesterday!
author: Robyn W.

description:
The boyfriend and I came here when we first started dating. We had almost finished with my surprise pre-birthday weekend in the city and I thought we should go somewhere to smoke since we really hadn't for a couple days (thank you, non-smoking hotels in SF  /sarcasm). He Yelped, and like man discovered fire, such is the glorious story of how we discovered Occidental.

We were warmly welcomed when we stepped in. It happened to be some guys birthday too, so we had the birthday conversation that you have when you find out it's also someones birthday and you're indirectly celebrating it with a stranger. That guys friend came in later and gave dude props for his Giants gear and gave me a hug for...well, just to give me one. Yvette was managing the bar, and she was totally fabulous. 

With dude being the cigar aficionado and me being a whiskey girl, we were in total good company. After a couple Springbanks, Yvette had us try some rum and we enjoyed it all with a couple cigars and the general ambiance of the place. 

I'll always love Occidental because of the memories we made here....but even if that weren't the case, I'd still give the place five stars. To be in the midst of good people, smoking, drinking whiskey with the games on.....you almost can't beat it.

We love you, Yvette!! See you soon!

Five smoking stars!
author: Leilani A.

description:
I almost want to give a negative review so this place will not get filled up and over crowded.  I'd like to keep it my little secret.

We have been going to the Occidental Cigar club for many years.  Almost every time we are in the city.

If I lived in the city I would be a regular.

What makes it special?  So many things.  Having a great cigar and drink while sitting at a bar is just one of the great things.

The owners, who work the bar, are always very attentive and entertaining.  Plus they know their stuff, whether it's rum, scotch, wine or cigars.

Then there is the clientele.  Something about a cigar bar.  The people are very friendly and have interesting stories to tell.  Plus, enjoying a cigar and a fine glass of scotch or rum is a social thing.

It's one of the few places in California where you can legally sit at a bar and have a cigar.  

Keep up the good work...
author: Michael R.

description:
Love, Love, Love this place.  It is a little pricey but, the atmosphere makes up for it.  It is the only indoor cigar bar in the area.  Cigar selection is small but you can bring your own.  Great mix of people.  Great place to kick back and relax after a long day.

"Happiness?  A good cigar, a good meal, a good cigar and a good woman - or a bad woman; it depends on how much happiness you can handle."  George Burns
author: Melissa B.

description:
Love this place - great for a smoke and a drink with Great Barkeeps! Go there every other week.

Hit Occidental Saturday night w/ some friends - Bob was bartending. He really knows his wines and the outstanding selection of liquor: Bourbons, Scotch etc. that NOBODY carries in the city - and great prices. 

They have a better wine selection than some wine bars - with more reasonable prices.
author: Rew C.

description: Went there with some buddies. I wanted to try something unique. Smoking indoors with a group of guys and talking was a great way to end the night. Mellow vibe in there. Two humidors with cigars. Tried the mild cigar for $18. Like the fact they have TVs to watch while enjoying the smoke. Place is small, so 4 ppl max so you don't have to worry about seating.
author: john C.

description:
Negatives: Hole in the wall bar with no comfortable lounge seating just old and uncomfortable bar stools.  If you are expecting a classic Cigar Bar you will be disappointed 

Positives: Good conversation and the TVs are nice ...
author: John H.

description: This place was pretty chill. I'm accustomed to lounge chairs and cheaper prices (Long Beach,Ca) but I met a cool Brotha name Che that was cool as a fan. We talked so intently and he even offered a place to stay right after we traded stories. Definitely worth visiting but don't take the prices out on the owner, blame the city and its increased taxes on cigar smoking. The few negatives: only one bartender, the venue was fairly smokey and the  heighten cigar prices.
author: RP P.

description:
I love this place! It is a great place to kick back after a long day and enjoy a drink and a cigar without fear of persecution. It's the only indoor cigar bar/lounge in the Bay Area. 

They have a wide selection of scotch, cognac, bourbon, and wine. Their drink prices are slightly higher, but I am more than happy to pay the higher prices to keep these guys in business! SUPPORT LOCALLY OWNED BUSINESSES!

Only drawback is that they have a limited selection of cigars. You are more than welcome to bring your own cigars though. 

Their service has been second to none. Always friendly and helpful.

Oh, to the guy that gave this place a one-star review because you didn't enjoy your first experience with cigars, really!? That's like a vegan going to a steakhouse and giving them a bad review because he realized he didn't like meat.
author: Joe B.

description:
I love this place even though I quit smoking.. and loved it when I did smoke. Clubby little hideaway where you always run into someone you know & they make strong drinks & provide chit-chat if you're in the mood or leave you alone if you're with friends. Beautiful (& clean) bar with brass rails, comfy stools & a few tables.

Great bar in the Financial District. Just be prepared to smell like an ashtray when you leave. And nip some matches before you go: They're the real thing, sturdy wood matches in a cool little red box.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Yvette is a co-owner and bartender. She knows whiskey, wine and cigars! I HIGHLY recommend this place!
author: Martin H.

description:
i should be giving this place "negative stars" instead of 5...

every single time i go here...i end up stumbling out...wake up with a mean hangover...feel sick to my stomach from smoking cigars all night...and literally reek of an ashtray...last week...i blacked out there...i have no recollection of leaving or paying until the next morning when i found my credit card receipt...

why would anyone that has the same horrible experience everytime give 5 stars you ask? 

because i LOVE this place...

right when you walk in, you feel at home...all the guys behind the bar are great...the reason why i always get DESTROYED there is because they are always having me try different drinks...start off with a nice round Cabernet...then work on a 18 year whiskey...then some random scotch...then back to a Zin...10 drinks in...im trashed...

did i say i LOVE this place yet? i do.

Occidental has a small selection of cigars and a great selection of booze...if youre a scotch/whiskey lover...this is a spot that you have to try...they have some bottles there that ive never even heard of...

like i said before...the guys behind the bar are great...always joking around and having fun...what a great place to go to work to everyday...

note: a new restaurant opened up next door and last time i was there, we were able to order food and eat it inside...whether this is a permanent thing or not, im not completely certain....but if it is the case...Occidental immediately becomes a go-to late night grubbing spot as well

LOVE this place!
author: Kyu L.

description: I have been here over a couple dozen times and have always enjoyed the atmosphere.  A large group of my friends and I (from cigar lounge on Santana Row, San Jose) have been coming here once a month over the past few months always having a blast.  Small cigar selection but quality choices.  They have a menu of high end spirits, beer and wine.  Love this place.
author: Don G.

description: Impulse stop while touring San Fran, jumped off the California line, and walked on block over.  We had a great afternoon, sampling bourbons, beer, and enjoying a nice cigar.  Classic old style charm bar, cigar friendly, and very personable staff.  If you want to take a break, I highly recommend.
author: Bradley S.

description:
First off I was randomly dying to try this place since I was having a cigar fling. I have no idea why, though. I don't smoke, I'm not an old man, and I don't drink scotch. I almost feel bad for giving it 1 star just because this is NOT my cup o'  tea!

This is the only place I know of in SF that is a bar you can smoke inside. If I were a smoker this place may be ideal. I tried a cigar with some bourbon and I was WAY in over my head! 

The cigar wasn't too bad. It had a nasty after effect though. I stunk so bad after and I had the taste lingering in my mouth for hours-yuck. 

It was a dive-y bar but you could smell it from a block away (the smoke smell). One of the owners, Jack helped us out. He seemed very knowledgeable about cigars and old-man alcohol. I just had higher expectations. Oh well, at least I tried it...
author: Chanelle N.

description: Best bar in SF. Every bartender that works here is a co-owner and it's hard to understate what that means for quality. Deeply knowledgeable service, and if you're price-sensitive they will make sure you have the time of your life on that budget. It's the perfect place to bring clients or friends you want to impress, or if you just want to kick back... there is nothing better than the Occidental.
author: Carter F.

description: Very nice and quaint spot! Went there with my husband on our first trip to the bay area. Found it on yelp. The owner, Tom , was very hospitable. Met some great #BOTL. Small humidor but it has good cigar options for the cigar aficionado and am extensive scotch and bourbon selection.
author: Traci J.

description: Its a bar that serves cigars.  I think if it were a little bit bigger with some more seating area in particular I'd be more inclined to give this another star.  It's about the size of a 1 bedroom apartment, which I imagine would make it very crowded with more than 20 people inside, and exponentially smokier.  Didn't seem like there was too much ventilation, but I guess if you have an apprehension towards smoke you shouldn't be going to a cigar bar.
author: Kyle I.

description:
This is such an awesome spot if you want to come with a date who dances or with a group.  I especially love the outside section where you can smoke your head off and sit around large communal type tables and make new friends.  The service is decent and the drinks are pretty standard.  I think this place has a bit of something for everyone.....music or just a bar - 3 distinct areas in a large space so you can go wherever your mood takes you.  And don't forget the live Latin music.  It's a FUN PLACE for sure and they have a good cigar selection - but feel free to bring your own too!
I had some of the food here too and it was good - can't remember what I had though because I was pretty drunk, sorry.
author: Kyle K.

description: I've been looking for a place to smoke cigars in San Francisco for a while now and finally found this spot. Very cool. It's a small space, but honestly, that doesn't bother me at all. The club is owner operated, which is why you are allowed to smoke inside and I met Bob Saturday night. Very nice guy, easy to talk to and really knows his cigars. Unlike some of the places I am used to on the Peninsula, you can bring your own stogies or buy them at the club. It's a cool spot, great location and I will be back soon.
author: Hector G.

description: Just what I was looking for.  Owner/operator was very nice, great ambiance, awesome selection of booze.  Price was right for the pour.  I will be going back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Sonny P.

description:
My last public cigar and spirit collective experience was inside a eating establishment was in Cartagena, Columbia.  I never thought I would kick back and enjoy the luxury and freedom to do the same on my home turf.

The California 1995 smoking ban law does not apply to this owner operated establishment in San Fransisco, no sirree, smoking IS PERMITTED inside!

To enhance your cigar experience OCC offers an extensive high-end list of single-malt scotches, single-barrel bourbons, premium rums & world class wines.

The humidor is filled with selections of premium brand cigars to suit anyone from the novice to the connoisseur.  

Check the Rickhouse, just around the corner, a trendy bar that offers a wide selection of premium tasty concoctions that are reasonably priced!
author: Jamie C.

description:
Stopped by here for three nights to watch the Giants game.  Very friendly staff and Yvette the bartender/owner was always very attentive even though the bar was often times very busy and I am not a big drinker.  The cigar selection was eclectic and geared toward the aficionados, which I am not.   The club rules provide that if do not buy a cigar from them, there is a two drink minimum when you bring your own cigars like I did.  Under the circumstances, this is a very reasonable requirement and drink prices are not exorbitant.

The liquor selection Is excellent with outstanding wines, a wide assortment of whiskies, scotches and liquors.  As I am not a big wine or hard liquor consumer, the beer selection was very good and the four they have on tap are excellent as well.

The bar is not very big and gets crowded quickly.  The crowd is friendly and this bar comes closest to the tv show "Cheers" that I have encountered on the mainland.
author: Russel Y.

description: if you want something classy, this is the place. They have a good sellection of cigars. Enviroment is manly, the way it should be. We met a nice fellow, chatted, had real nice bear and a cigar and the host/owner/bartender Baba is the right man for the job. Friendly, professional, mature, respectful. Thank you.
author: Winston D.

description:
Wow I like this place.  Bob the bartender is super cool.  You have an old bar and you can fire up your cigar and eat and drink!  They have several plasma tvs so they should be playing your game.  The bartender even partakes in a cigar on occassion.

This is the only indoor cigar place I have seen in recent history in California that serves alcohol and allows smoking.  6 stars for that!
author: Rob Y.

description:
A cigar that's not pretentious. This place is great. You walk in and it feels old school. I'm not a cigar expert but decided to meet up with my cousin for drinks and we felt like having a couple cigars and since it's just a couple blocks from where we work we came here.

Old school is the best way to describe this place. It's not a mixology bar, they don't have the big single cube ice cubes but they have a decent selection of whiskeys with a decent pour. 

Here's another tip. If you get hungry you can order from the Italian place next door and they'll take your order over then a waiter brings the food over with the bill. It's pretty sweet. Plated delivery almost like room service. Pretty cool. 

It was great place to watch the World Series. Even for that it wasn't too crowded so we easily sat at the bar.
author: Hyung L.

description: I went looking for a cigar shop as I always do when I travel.  Somebody said old boys network.  I did not think so, although I was the only girl, everyone made me feel welcome.  I sat at the bar, had two fabulous ports.  Thomas was great and knew his stuff.  Loved it.  Will be back in a heartbeat.  Plus I made a new friend
author: Sterling H.

description: Awesome place and only place in the city you can smoke cigar inside ..Soon as you walk in you get the feel of this lounge .. Yevett made our night most joyful with her outgoing personality and her funny short stories separates this place from others and, She has a wealth of knowledge when it comes to picking out the right stick (cigars)  which to me is very important, also her culinary background led us to some awesome places  to eat.. To put it in short, looking for a place to kick back while in the city .. The occidental is the place to go...
author: Slex A.

description:
Great Bar in the financial district.  Every time I've been there, I've met two or three people and stayed far longer than I planned.  It's just that kind of place.  A lot of out of towners and locals all looking to chat and enjoy cigars.  The owners are really nice, and serve great drinks.  

Not a place for wallflowers.  First time I went, I expected to kill an hour with a book.  Not that kind of bar, but in a good way!
author: Matt B.

description: Cozy little place in the financial district. The bar tender was very helpful in picking out a cigar and flavorful rum that complimented each other nicely. The crowd was interactive and friendly. Great place to sit and relax after a long day of sight seeing!
author: jessy s.

description:
How good is this place.  It's smokey, but what would you expect from a cigar club.  The peopel in here are friendly.  The bartender was good and made some really good drinks.

I was surprised to see so many ladies smoking cigars!

They have a great scotch and bourbon collection.  If you like to smoke cigars, meeting nice people....then this is a good place to be.
author: Kenneth G.

description:
This is one of the only places in the City to smoke a cigar indoor. That alone makes it awesome. Since it's only one block from my gym, I often walk here after working out. 

The humidor selection is not great. I have my own tastes, and my usual compromise at cigar lounges goes as such:

1. Buy an inexpensive cigar from their humidor.
2. Smoke the cigar I brought in.

If it's a rare cigar, I remove the band. That way customers aren't asking what I'm smoking and why it's not stocked in the humidor. This also prevents the owners from raising any hackles.

Plus, it's a matter of person ethics. A bar has overhead, so it's tacky to bring your own while not supporting the establishment. I view Step 1 as a form of paying rent - since, after all, the place does indeed have rent to pay. (And the rent is too damn high!)
author: Michael C.

description: My roommate, brother, and I visited the occ in November. I had such a fun time. My roommate and brother bought cigars and I just drank whiskey. The bartenders had healthy pours, let me sample one that he was aging before buying it and suggested great drinks to pair with the cigars. I can't wait to go back.
author: Jen C.

description: Probably one of the only bars in SF that a girl can go without being bothered by creepers! Not to mention you can actually smoke inside, away from the cold! This is my third visit and it is such a comfortable space, no one bothers you and the staff is wonderful. It is very casual and it is apparent that douchebags don't hang out here. My new favorite spot!
author: Brianna C.

description:
Update to my last post on the Occidental Cigar Club, or as us regulars call it, the "ox". Here's the last true cigar bar in San Francisco, an amazing place with amazing owners. Each night is a different experience. Come see how this place became "cheers on steroids"  A mixture of locals and tourists and business travelers...but all are warmly welcomed. Nice cigar selection and huge scotch & whiskey menu.
Come on out. We might just be there.  haha.
author: Mark W.

description: Nice little find.  Knowledgeable bar tender and good whiskey/scotch selection.  Very nice cigar selection, but they are bit pricey.  Only downside is that it is not well ventilated at all.
author: Steve S.

description:
Pro's: 
- Indoor smoking in the Financial District (Where else can you grab a stick, and a drink if you so incline, right after work and sit around for hours smoking, debating on whether it's time to waddle-on home before the wife puts a missing person alert out on you) 
- Jake, the bartender, is a really cool guy. Makes you feel at home. 
- Ambiance: this must be what a Speakeasy felt like back-in-the-day. 

Con's: 
- Selection is limited. They have only a hand full of brands/types. 
- Spendy. A stick can set you back 20 bucks, where elsewhere would be about half the price.
author: Justin S.

description:
Around the corner from Rickhouse is Occidental Cigar Club. It's not a trendy place. It's too bright. There aren't a lot of people in it other than a few regulars chatting at the corner of the bar.

But I think I found my go-to bar in SF if I ever wanted whiskey and didn't want to mess around with cocktails.

You know you're in a good place when the bartender wants to give you a hug at the end of the night.

Pros- huge, I mean HUGE whiskey list
Cons- it's not trendy, and a bit smokey because of the cigars
author: Min T.

description:
Friday night. Decadent, elegant, personal attention without fawning, a manly space without the harassment. It's like temporarily living in another dimension. Expensive, but worth the trip.

Just you younger fellows, under the influence, remember that one f-word carries weight...one every third word right in the ear is interrupting other's mellow pleasure and loses all meaning. However, it was past 1 a.m., so I'm forgiving.

Ask Kurt about the cherries & vermouth, they're to die for even if you may think you don't like them. He also knows a fascinating amount of history and fact, true dedication to his craft, and helpful to new clients as well as friendly toward old. I hope to return.

Here's one more pleasant review for the curious to read!
author: Ziggy J.

description:
Based on the reviews, I was REALLY looking forward to enjoying some contraband at this cigar bar - good reviews, and only two blocks from where we were staying in SF.  

We got there at the end of a Giants game, so understandably, it was jam-packed.  The crowd quickly died off, however, and we were able to get a seat at the bar and looking around whilst I smoked said bone.

Impressions - a very "Norm!" kinda neighborhood bar.  Small selection of smokes for those who didn't bring their own, and a good selection of wine and liquor.  Also a good choice of draft beers (Stella on tap...that was a star right there).    

Ended up cutting the bone short, however (and MAN do I hate that)...for good reason.  This, unfortunately, is a bar that allows cigars...NOT a cigar bar (a HUGE difference!).  More than one completely soused idiot were present...and as one became more and more belligerent, it became obvious that he really wasn't going to calm down anytime soon...and rather by a bystander at a bar fight, we chose to go.

Still on a quest for a real cigar bar in SF.  Knickerbockers remains the Bay Area standard is really the bottom line.
author: Bill O.

description: This review is about their whiskey selection, which is excellent. Jameson18 and Bushmill16 were perfect pours. Clean place and a nice crowd if you are okay with the cigar second-hand smoke. Good five stars...
author: Derek N.

description: Great time!  Hidden gem.  Had a great rum and a fine cigar
author: Angelo L.

description: Great place to smoke. Wonderful Scotch selection. Not a huge cigar selection BUT what's here is a sure shot for a good smoke. Friendly staff, great feel and love the selection of food you can have delivered or brought in
author: David V.

description: Ladies please put the seat cover back in the right place after going ... This is a top notch place for ciggies and booze. If you're in SF you have to go.
author: Denise W.

description:
I was here yesterday: Yvette is wonderful. I tasted very interesting rums with my cigar, chosen from a very good selection, although limited.
The idea of a cigar bar is very smart. Besides, this bar is small, so very cozy.
I felt as being in a very familiar atmosphere, although I was there for the first time: the other (multi-cultural) customers were very nice and kind.
I will certainly return.
author: Franca C.

description: Absolutely terrible. This place is bullshit. Last night I roll up at 11:30pm with 11 other guys on a bachelor party night. We finished our steaks and wanted to smoke some cigars and drink some scotch. We show up and the door is locked. The bartender does the "we're closed" sign with his hand across his neck. Fine don't take 12 guys worth of money at 11:30 when the sign on your door says you're open until 1am. We had fully intended on each guy buying a couple of drinks each and buying some cigars. Never again. Enjoy going broke.
author: Brian R.

description: As a cigar smoker in SF this is one of my only safe havens! Friendly Staff, great patrons, good drinks and a fun place to enjoy a cigar. Thank Goodness for The Occidental!!!
author: philip S.

description:
We live in a world of endangered pleasures. I mean, am I the only person who thinks a 3 martin lunch is a good idea? And what about this whole thing with wearing seat belts. Well, maybe that is a good idea. 

While I don't regularly smoke anything, there are certain occasions where a fresh cigar is not just called for, but should be mandatory. I'm talking bachelor parties, high stakes poker, and the birth of a baby boy.

Considering the latter just happened for me, a few of my close pals and I went over to the Occidental to enjoy a few choice smokes.

The bar isn't that big but you can count on every single customer to be smoking cigarettes, cigarillos, cigars, even a pipe or two. You can bring your own, but they also stock some good ones (albeit at a noticeable mark-up).

With a full bar, consisting of an excellent array of wines and scotches that fit the cigar aficionado lifestyle and Sinatra on permanent play, here's where the casual decadence of the good life can be found, if only as a temporary respite from the day to day responsibilities of your normal life.

Special Note for my single friends: Girls who hang out at cigar bars are crazy and bold!
author: Nish N.

description:
I had a great experience meeting the owners of Occidental cigar club this past monday. I had a great experience talking to them about their award winning whiskey and scotch list and learning about the city which is new to me. 
I will def become a regular of this place. 

Thank you
author: Brian R.

description: I rolled into this joint by accident and I can't recommend highly enough. Jake and the crew were really hospitable. Coming all the way from Australia and knowing no one; a few drinks and hours later I had already met multiple like minded people who also enjoy their cigars. Highly recommended.
author: Luke C.

description:
It was kind of like running into an old flame.  The spark is still there.  Pun intended as it is a cigar club. 

I went recently with some friends.  New cigars in the humidor - a better selection, I think. 

I met bartender Jake.  I wanted Port with my cigar.  He asked me to try a rum, and I did.  Excellent call.  The rum (Zaya) was an outstanding compliment to my cigar.  (RP 15th Anniversary)

One of my friends apparently knew Jake from a previous visit.  He told me that Jake has a philosophy that one should drink from a place that makes cigars if the drinker is smoking cigars.  After his recommendation, I do believe I can subscribe to that prescription.  Good call, sir.  Good call.
author: Steve D.

description: My favorite place to smoke cigars in SF. There is an expansive list of whiskeys and a great selection of cigars. Plus the prices are very reasonable.
author: Michael F.

description: I live in SJ but was in the city to celebrate my birthday the night before. Went to occidental on the 4th of July and I loved that place. Its got a nice homely feeling and Yvette was super nice. We were thinking of going to the jazz festival and Yvette helped us find couple spots but we ended up staying at occidental the whole time. Smoked couple sticks and played cards with my girl. Socialized with the locals. Yvette gave me a free pour of my favorite scotch for my birthday and locals wished me happy birthday as we were walking out. I'm definitely hanging out there every time I'm in the city!
author: I K.

description:
This place is great and filled with a good cast of characters.  I'm not the most knowledgeable about Scotch or cigars but I give them a budget for what I want to spend and what I'm looking for and I'm rarely disappointed. 

They have some very interesting Bourbons as well.  Definitely worth giving it a shot even if cigars aren't your life.
author: Robert J.

description: A fun and classy establishment all the way.  Where else can you have dinner delivered to your seat at the bar, and enjoy a fine cigar and cocktail afterward without leaving your stool.  Ah salute!
author: Johnny C.

description: Friendliest bartender/owner. My only complaint is that it gets a little too smokey and the cigars are somewhat overpriced. Limited cigar collection, but all of them are high quality cigars.
author: Dustin S.

description: I went after work for a Friday smoke for the first time and had a great experience. Just make sure you get there before six to find a seat . A wide variety of scotch and whiskey. A great go to place for cigar lovers. Just a bit small
author: Eduardo B.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE.   Small and cozy - great service.  Yvette behind the bar is super fun to hang with.    She also introduced me to Diplomatico Rum.   Now my liquor of choice.   I go back whenever I'm in San Fran...
author: Chiqui T.

description: Amazing service, so friendly and so very helpful. I totally recommend this place to EVERYONE! I needed something to soothe my fiance's outrage over how much I spent on wedding stuff, and the very kind lady working the bar helped me choose cigars thatI believe will do the trick. I didn't find it smokey at all for a cigar bar, and the whiskey selection seemed very nice.
author: RK B.

description: Great place to smoke a good cigar and have a amazing drink to compliment it.  The owner is the best!
author: Ashley B.

description: I would consider this my Mecca. TVs to watch football, a small but elegant selection of cigars and an almost solely liquor selection.  I am from out of town and i made friends with the bartender and the people next to me almost immediately.  Such interesting and nice people it made the whole experience of my first night here fantastic.  The decor is beautiful.  It's a small establishment, but I really like that feel.  This is a sophisticated bar with sophisticated clientele.
author: Brian S.

description: I've been going here for years and after a visit last night I decided that it's time to share my enthusiasm.  The Occidental is the perfect place for a cigar and a drink.  I like that it's small yet my friends and I are always able to find seats, it's comfortable, the furnishings are upscale without being stuffy and the atmosphere is relaxed.  The guys working the bar always have great liquor recommendations and even the occasional sample.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Darren B.

description: Came here close to closing time on a Monday night and Yvette let me in and made me feel right at home with a Rocky Patel 1999 Toro. This is definitely my new SF hang!
author: Fred S.

description: Great place to smoke a cigar and get a drink. They had a small but premium selection of cigar and which seemed like and endless whiskey menu.
author: Rowdy R.

description: Great place to have some of the most awesome cigars in San Francisco. Great place to hang out with your men/women who love cigars.
author: Rahul V.

description: Totally agree with Mark.  Bartenress!!  Very true.  Yvette is great.  Vodka glasses are tall, the drinks are strong, and the events are always a ton of fun.
author: Alex R.

description: Love this place!! Only indoor smoking bar in San Fran. The entire staff is wonderful and drinks reasonable. Pretty good selection of mostly high end boutique brands. Prices are a little steep but worth it. I do bring my own sometimes and as long as I buy drinks there hasn't been concerns. I come here every time I get into the city.
author: Bryan K.

description:
A quick trip brought me here and I promised the owner's I would write a snipped about this place. Reminded me of back home. I love my cigars and appreciate places that have good selections and aren't trying to ripe you off at the same time.

Crowd was fun and easy to meet made more friends here in a short time than any one day in LA thus far.

Cheers
author: Steve W.

description: The owner doesn't know a lot about cigars, the cigars are double or triple the normal price, the drinks are expensive, and your shoes stick to the floor, but it's inside and you can smoke there, so it is what it is - a bastion of freedom and sanity in an upside-down, nanny-state city. The owner will give you good-natured crap about bringing your own cigars, but if you let him choose a drink for you, you're all good.
author: Robert D.

description:
I don't smoke cigars.  Unlike Clinton, I don't know how to "not inhale" and it's not for lack of trying neither...so what the hell am I doing here?  My friends love to smoke cigar and hubby enjoys it too so whenever we get together, we are looking for places they can enjoy their favorite smoke.

This place is small but that's what make it so great.  It's not stuffy or pretentious.  The bartender, Bubba, is great and his buddy, Lance, is awesome.  Met a regular, Dante, here and he was super nice.  Been here twice, both great experiences.

We came in here after dinner and a day of drinking and snacking, I was stuffed to my nose. Lance said to have a shot of Fernet and sip ginger ale...I was willing to try and goodness it worked!  I have tried this trick since and it works like a charm each time. 

You know this place is a "men's place" - above the toilet in the unisex bathroom is a sign, check it out yourself...I had to smile.

Look forward to visiting again...
author: Gloria H.

description:
What a place! A great place to hang out and SMOKE cigars. I screamed in capitals because if you don't like cigars you wont like it. 
Mainly men, smoking fat stogies, drinking excellent whiskies and, obviously talking rubbish. 
Unlike the Cigar Bar & Grill they might charge you a fee to smoke your own cigars. It lost a star because in my view the humidor could and should be bigger with a greater selection. 
In contrast, the manager introduced me to a fab whiskey I have never seen back home in London, a Bulleit Rye. Delicious!!
If this place was in London, I would be a loyal regular.
Definitely worth a trip if you are in SF and you like a smoke.
author: Nick P.

description:
We totally loved this place.  I don't smoke cigars or anything, but decided on a whim while on vacation in SF that I should have one. Partly because in Seattle there's no place whatsoever that you can smoke a cigar indoors, partly because there's nothing like sipping a single-barrel bourbon and smoking a cigar when you want to feel extra manly. 

We came in on a Friday night at around 10pm, and were immediately put at ease by the outgoing and friendly character behind the bar, Lance ("What can you do. What CAN you do? You can't do a damn thing.. ") 
A number of regulars were there and they introduced themselves, and we felt right at home. Great conversation and drinks. My gf was happy to find a place she could smoke AND drink in. Also, there's excellent ventilation inside - even though I did have a cigar (well, half of one), I'm a pretty dedicated non-smoker, and I wasn't bothered at all by the smoke. 
We had a blast, and ended up closing the joint. They even gave us some cool empty cigar boxes to take home as souvenirs. Can't wait to go back on the next trip down.
author: stephen a.

description: Came here not expecting much considering it's San Francisco were you might as well be hung for smoking in the street. I was quite surprised when I arrived and found a great selection of cigar. On my first night I smoked a Padron 1926 Series Maduro and a few Stouts. The atmosphere was mellow, and the bartender who was also one of the owners had some pretty awesome blues playing. I went back a second night and indulged a little more with a Padron 50 Years Maduro and some whiskey, along with some samples provided by the bartender who was also another owners. All in all a pretty good environment, testosterone filled to say the least, which coming from the east coast I can respect. This place has a fantastic cigar selection and an even more fantastic whiskey collection. Will def be stopping in here on business trips to the West Coast.
author: Scott G.

description: The Occidental Cigar Club is my home away from home.  Great atmosphere, great people, great bartenders.  Do yourself a favor and go here if you are in San Francisco!
author: John S.

description: Great, great spot.  I love cigars, and the staff was great (and all owners, as advertised).  Great vibe, small environment, and good whiskey selection.  Knowledgeable folks!
author: Martin S.

description: Small stinky bar with the rudest bartender/co-owner. I'll never go back. The Cigar Bar and Grill is a much nicer venue that that dive bar.
author: Dan O.

description: Fantastic! I had a long day organizing a conference and walked in shattered. Guy behind the bar saw my state and got me started on some rums of his choosing and a cigar. Also had convivial company next to me and two hours flew by. I wish I was in San Fran more so I could R&R there more. Staff are great, you can have food brought in from a local restaurant. I had a lovely evening!
author: Guy E.

description: I was looking for a place to have a good smoke and a simple drink on my own. Perfect. Homy feel. Relaxed and casual. Small and simple with all kinds of jazz and Mexican trumpet music (sorry) coming out from the speakers. Direct service and a pleasant buzz from peeps, smoking, drinking and laughing. Great
author: Martin W.

description: Thank god this place is still here in a city with so many anti-smoking nazis. Smoke, baby, smoke!!
author: Lindy H.

description: Great cigar bar. My buddy has been talking about this place and we finally went there. Bartender was awesome and the ambience is perfect. For those who gave this place 1 star because you don't like cigars. Really??  Duh????
author: Tim T.

description: Wow!  I'm not really a cigar smoker, but I was interested in trying a nice one, and stopped by here.  Well, the lady working the bar was incredibly friendly; she managed to help me pick one, and then when I noticed the scotch selection, I was floored.  I tried a number of scotches and ended up with a 32 year old Glenn Grant.  Seriously, 32 years old - wow.  It was sweet and delicious.  Anyway, the icing on the cake was the fact that she was playing Richard Cheese (lounge singer who does covers) over the music system, which was brilliant.  I've been to some really fine cigar bars in Tokyo, even one at the top of the Park Hyatt (where Lost in Translation was filmed), and they may be bigger, but I had a lot more fun here.  My girlfriend says it was the "best bar ever"
author: Travis H.

description: Cigar, Wine & family.  These are the moments to enjoy in this life.
author: Rob L.

description:
I've been coming here for several years whenever I visit the Bay Area. The owners/bartenders are really down to earth guys that continually make us feel at home. I was there on a normal Wednesday night and ended up talking sports with a guy from LA and a lawyer that recently lost the election (no idea who he was since i'm not from here).

Great selection of Single Malt Scotch as well as wine. Also, there are cigars for sale if you come empty handed...

I'll continue to come as long as I continue to visit San Francisco...
author: Daniel A.

description: If you like the "Mad Men" type feel and atmosphere, this is your place.  My girlfriend took me here on my birthday and we both loved the drinks and ambiance.
author: Ryan M.

description: One of the few places in the fine California state where you can light up a fat cigar,  and have a glass of smooth amber scotch that rolls down your throat and warms your bones. All wood bar and comfy stools make you feel like your are on the set of Cheers with Norm. Giant TVs and lively regulars make the place vibrate and sparkle. Fine place to go and unwind after a loooooong day at work.
author: Pinky F.

description: Great spot to try some excellent different scotches and spend some quality time with some close friends. The staff is excellent and very helpful.
author: Al G.

description:
This place is great. Went there last night with a friend for her birthday. The beers were cold, the cigars were tasty, the owners were nice, and the patrons were too. 

They were great on service, both with beer and water. Cigar selection isn't the largest, but more than enough to match the size of the place. And, you can always BYO if you are picky. 

My only complaint could be the beer list. It was okay, but not creative. That cost it a star. It would be great to see more local or exotic beers on the list.  To their credit, they have Ranger IPA in the cue, and they had boddington's available as well as newcastle. 

Great place. Not smoky despite the cigars, I will be back!
author: Kris K.

description:
This place Is I will admit, not without it's handful of criticisms, but rather than having you believe that this is not a good place to go to, let me say that maybe let this review give you what you should expect from this place and that if that is what you're looking for then yes come to this place because it will probably be your favorite bar.

As far as the criticisms go, here are mine. The place is cozy to say the least. It's actually rare even on weekends to see this place packed but it's not hard to do so. It isn't the kind of place that would be convenient for a large party or events. I personally have never inquired about private parties so I don't know about that one. There is a markup on the cigars that they carry here so if you don't bring your own be sure to remember what you're spending on the cigar, though as of late it is one of the better humidors in the city. It is also very much geared towards a male clientele so I would understand feeling apprehensive about bringing a lady friend with you. Finally, and while this is a criticism this is incredibly understandable considering the nature of the bar, you will come out of the place smelling like an ashtray. 

Now that we covered the negatives, let's talk about why you should come here and why you shouldn't let said negatives stop you. Though it is a relatively small place, there is almost always seating, the few exceptions is on game days and when there is some kind of event or business conference in the city. It is the last good place to find cigars in the city. They will let you eat there and have menus behind the bar of various good restaurants That deliver to this place, including the restaurant next door. All the bartenders are very friendly and are knowledgeable about the spirits and the cigars they can provide. Their selection changes around from time to time and they're always of good quality. Very nice atmosphere, unpretentious and full of tongue in cheek humor. One of the better selections of beers, wines, and fine spirits. One of the few places who pride themselves on good service but not stuffy. It has that hospitable, almost family feel to it.

All in all this place is a specialty bar and obviously the appeal of this place is not as universal as other bars strive to be, but of you want a good beverage to go with your cigar, have a good conversation about spirits, tobacco, or the nature of existence, maybe even catch a game or two then this'll be the place tailor made for your tastes.
author: Nicholas J.

description:
Great place to smoke, drink and be merry!

Lance is the best a bar could ask for - he's personable, funny, and cute too boot. 

Two TV screens for your sports viewers out there but don't expect any sound other then from your fellow bar mates. Which you will love - the regulars are super friendly, but don't come in with an attitude or they'll kick ya out.

Just gotta love this place.
author: Ka C.

description:
I don't smoke anything and this is by far my favorite bar in San Francisco. 

Any night of the week is a good night. Jake, Jack, & James are all entertaining. The usuals are great to hang out with - you can even catch a game or two of dice cups (liar's dice). This is a great place to bring a friend or go by yourself. I always meet the most interesting people.

I have the bar on speed dial and consider many of the people that I've met at The Occidental over the years good friends. 

Oh, and if you are hungry, all of the restaurants in the alley deliver to the bar.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Utterly amazed at the crowd, service, ambiance, and variety of drinks they have.  Literally sat down and one of the fellas offered me a slice of pizza. I feel spoiled here. Great place to sit back and enjoy a cigar and a wonderful drink. The bartender, Jake, took good care of me. Will be back for sure!
author: Arman B.

description:
There was a group of 6 of us from out of town that took the stroll down from our hotel to have a smoke and a drink.  We called for the hours and they said were open until 2AM.  We arrived at 10PM and they said they were closed.  While someone was let in right behind us, that person said "Sorry I know the manager".  

We regularly visit the SF area.  Needless to say, we will not be coming back.  Too many good spots around town to waste an evening here.
author: Chi-Chi L.

description: A must "stop"! Phenomenal place. I highly recommend if you love cigars and want a great place to enjoy with a cool atmosphere. Terrific drinks and selection as well.
author: Honest O.

description:
Fine place to enjoy an after-work or lunchtime cigar. The Occidental carries a short but sweet stock of cigars and an impressive liquor list to match. Scotch and cigars were born to wed and the gents behind the bar do a fine job to make sure you'll enjoy a happy marriage. 

Don't plan impressing anyone with your scent after leaving here, it's straight to drycleaners.
author: Phil M.

description:
This is a great bar to hang while your wife/SO is shopping.  The owner was cordial and very knowledgeable about the drink.  The bar has two big screens for every sport.  It is always better to bring your own stick.  
Great place and has great scotch collection.
author: Al B.

description: Hands down, my favorite bar in San Francisco due to the owners and the regulars. Its nearly a club but without the red tape and fees. Always good for a good laugh and an intriguing conversation. A good place to go alone and shoot the shit w/ the owners/bartenders or with friends. Its my guess that the average regular there has an IQ level of around 125 +. It is also not large enough to bring in the obnoxious crowds. The Occi is a real bar and one of the last real bars in San Francisco in my opinion. They have a condensed and complex stock of liquor and wines to cater toward anyones palate and the owners/bartenders take pride in knowing whats on hand.The smoke alone breeds out the prudes as well as the pretentious. I no longer work in the Financial District and, I am an expecting mother so... Not happening for me so much anymore! I miss it and love it.
author: Out O.

description:
If a drink in the middle of a hectic busy work day..well more towards the end of the day...will help you re-energize...this place hits the spot...

My other overworked friend brought me here, because were still on the clock i just ordered coffee, he got his mild cocktails. Its cozy place to chill to relax your mind a bit again in the middle of  a madcrazybusy day.

Bartenders are cool and have dry sense of humor.

It doesnt hurt to stop by  this place. Go check it out.
author: Malou C.

description: Spent a few hours there on a recent Sunday waiting for my ferry. This is a fantastic place with a fun and engaging clientele. Yvette was VERY welcoming. In a city where smokers have been pushed out this is a wonderful refuge! I like patronizing small businesses like this one...will be back again when I have the time to sit and enjoy the atmosphere... Thanks Yvette!
author: Steve C.

description: Please never close. San Francisco municipal politicians hate indoor smoking, and apparently an adult's freedom of choice.
author: Aaron J.

description: Old school cigar bar, totally classy, with a very nicely curated selection of cigars and all manner of libations - and the bartender is a cigar geek who knows his stuff and is happy to talk about it. You should just know there is a $10 minimum, so you can't just go there to smoke without buying anything. A real gem.
author: Sergio H.

description:
This is what a cigar bar should be. Not pretentious, intimate, dark wood, relaxed music and great regular patrons. This is the perfect place to satisfy your occasional nicotine craving,  even if you aren't a smoker. I enjoy meeting an old friend here to chat calmly about life, recent trips, business ideas and recent disappointments.

We take so much fun out of life sometimes, trying to purify everything (water, sugar, bread, organic, blah, blah). Sometimes we just need to pollute our lungs with the deep rich smoke of a cigar and a whisky and relax.

Highly recommend this place. See you there!
author: Fabian O.

description: Ask the bartender Bubba for a Manhattan with your cigar. You won't regret it.
author: Linkie L.

description: What can you say about a place that has a "Smoking Permitted" sign outside?  Not enough.  Now, I am no smoker and I do enjoy the fact that I don't have to endure smoking in bars in California anymore.  However, it is nice to have a choice to go here, light up a decent cigar and have a good glass of my favorite Port or Sherry.  Ahhh, Winston would be proud!
author: Greg R.

description:
I don't smoke. I don't like cigarettes, much less cigars; but this place has a certain je nais c'est quois...  I met 2 of the 3 owners, Jake and James, and they are very kind and funny people.  They indulged me when I said I wasn't sure I wanted a full pint of Guinness (I had a couple already; instead, they poured the Half Pint (me) a half pint of my favorite stout.  They over indulged me when I asked if I could have A cigar box, in which to store some of the matchbooks I've collected over the years; they gave me some beautiful boxes, which I brought home.  They asked me to at least make a purse out of one of them...  I think it's my turn to indulge them. 

Knowing you'll leave their bar smelling like cigars/smoke, Jake keeps a stock of Febreeze on hand.  He Febreezed me before I left the bar; it's an interesting process...  You should ask him about it when you visit to save your significant other from the pungent scent of the cigars.

The bar feels like Cheers.  All the patrons know each other and they're very welcoming to the newbies.  After I told them I just lost my job, they were all so willing to help me find a new one.  One of the regulars, a wine broker, even offered to give me a nice bottle of wine next time I decide to hang out.

NORM!
author: Annalynn C.

description:
This place is wonderful....everything a cigar club should be.  And it's even better now that they have wireless internet access!

The atmosphere is perfect, all dark wood and nostalgia, the owners/bartenders are great, and the clientle are very interesting to talk to.  There is something about cigars that just makes people want to talk with strangers.

The other plus is the great selection of music that they always seems to be playing.  Very heavy on classic rock, but always something good.

My only complaint is the very very small selection of cigars, although this is offset by the fact that each one of their selections seems to be a great choice.  My favorite so far is the Padron.
author: Steven P.

description: My first time. It was cool. Relaxing and enjoyable but I don't see what the big deal is about cigars. If your into cigars it's the perfect place for men & women to enjoy each others company.  I envisioned more of a hide out, sort dark lit room and dark colored walls, comfortable couches and lounge chairs.
author: chazz l.

description:
Nice Scotch selection, though they don't have my favorite  (Bruichladdich).  I had the Oban 14 year (neat, with a tiny splash of water) instead--less peaty and spicy, but nice flavor and smooth.  

Cigar selection is a bit scant, but not bad.
author: Kimberly Q.

description: This small bar opens in the afternoon and gets pretty busy as the bankers get off work. It bills itself as a cigar bar but it really a smokers bar as there are usually more cigarette smoker than cigar smokers. Their drinks are reasonably priced for SF and they have a pretty good Scotch and Bourbon selection. Given the small number or places left that I can actually enjoy a nice VSG with my T&T after a hard days work, I have to give them 4 stars. If they had a better stocked humidor and a loung area I would bump it up to 5.
author: TPD O.

description: Expected the selection to be overwhelming being the highest rated shop here. Service was great though. Very informative. Good quality cigars for what they had.
author: Koby O.

description: If you are hankering for a cigar and some fine spirits then look no further.  Great selection of single malts and rums.  I had the Zaya Trinidad rum one visit and the Laphroaig 18 single malt the other time.
author: Bill J.

description: I've been here a couple of times, but not too often.  After my last experience, I might have to drop in more frequently.  I went with a couple of coworkers and spent a happy Friday evening drinking and smoking.  They have my favorite cigars and a stocked bar.  The music's not loud, and they play great tunes.  Definitely need to make this place a more frequent stop.
author: Ken M.

description:
I absolutely love this bar!  So what if I'm usually the youngest person, or only female in there when I go, and go alone I go!  I don't really have female friends that smoke cigars.  I know, going alone...strange, but this is the kind of place where you can go alone and sip on a martini while smoking your cigar.  Besides, it's small enough that people sitting at the bar, start speaking to you and what not.

Thought there'd be more cigar bars in S.F. but I've only come across a few.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Good wine, scotch and tequila selection, but cigar selection is very limited.  Great clientele, really cool place to chill in the financial district, and a big plus is that you can enjoy your smoke INDOORS!
author: Felipe M.

description:
I really like this place.  I was introduced to Occidental Bar during the cigar boom in the early 90's.  After the boom the crowds thinned which was nice.  Now it is frequented by regulars mostly from the financial district.  It is a great crowd and the bartenders are friendly and attentive.  I usually bring my own cigars but they have some in a humidor for sale.  OK selection of cigars but not great.  That this is one of the very few places that allow smoking inside is huge.  We have spent many rainy happy hours here relaxing with a cigar and scotch watching people running by soaked and miserable.  After a cigar or two and twice that many drinks, it could have been snowing and we didn't care.

This is a great smoking bar but most of all it is a great bar.  It never gets too smoky I would guess because they have a ventilation system that does the job.  For smokers, it's a must.  You won't regret it.  Quality booze and good crowd.
author: David S.

description: Quite enjoyed a few hours here.  They have a good bar with typical drinks for this type of bar (whiskey, scotch, cognac, etc.)  They even had a bottle of Lagavulin.  They have a limited selection of cigars that are only moderately well kept.  That doesn't sound like a good review but it was a fun place to hang out and smoke cigars.  This is a tiny place so don' t be surprised if it's crowded (we went by a couple of times).  The bartender was very friendly and helpful.  Service is at the bar only which was perfectly fine with me.  They  don't have room for a humidor so the cigars are just stored in some glass cases which might result in less than ideal aging what with the doors being opened all the time when people are getting things out.  But at the rate they were selling, nothing probably sits there very long.  Cigar prices were high but probably reasonable for single sales in a large, expensive city. Crowd was nice and the place was upscale.  It's on a side street and kind of hard to spot but use the directions.  If you are looking for a smoky hangout for drinks and cigars, this is definitely recommended.
author: Doug W.

description: The " warm" atmosphere is just a gimmick. The bartender was extremely rude and insulted me for no reason. There is also a sign that says in the restrooms "ladies, please put the seat back in its proper place". This bar is obviously patriarchal, as the majority of the people who come in are old men in their 50's/60's. If you're looking for an old grandpa type of feel, yes I say this is the right place for you...
author: Maite M.

description: I will give this place serious props for its attitude, its humor, its great cigars ,and the fact that the owner was totally gracious when I questioned the bill. What a find!
author: Allison L.

description: Best bar in San Francisco! Lance is the absolute best so be sure to ask for him. As previous reviews have stated you are promised good people watching, tasty drinks at a good price. What more could you want? LOVE the Occidental.
author: Andrea S.

description: The Occidental Cigar Club is a great little classy hang out spot, that is far from being pretentious. The service is superb, friendly and knowledgeable! The bar is very cozy and there is always a great group of patrons to mingle with! I love to sip on some quality Scotch and soak in the atmosphere! You don't need to smoke to enjoy this grand place, and if you have friends who do, they can enjoy themselves as well!
author: Matthew R.

description: Did we really have seven spicy margaritas each?  Did we really get so drunk that all of us non smokers thought the smoke wasn't really that bad?  Did we all reek of smoke and feel like shit the next morning?   Totally worth it. I just don't know when I have had so much fun in a very long time!!!  The bartender is a hoot.  This place is a blast!
author: Happy L.

description: Perfect place after dinner for a single malt  (I suggest the ardbeg 10yr if you r into the smoky stuff like me) and a Rocky Patel Edge. Substitute Cognac for Scotch depending on your mood.
author: Kaushick N.

description: There is excellent Scotch available here (try the 14 year old Oban), and Bob, the owner, is very willing to help out with the Cigar collection (even for the uninitiated).This place is totally a haven for men in San Francisco, and thank god for that.  For you Punjabi men out there, here's a place where you can pretend you are in the old country and drink fine scotch to your hearts content (accompanied if you are willing,  with a fine cigar).
author: Abhi S.

description:
so my friend was tired of smoking outside and i was tired of shivering while i wait for her to finish and stub it out so we decided to give it a go.  

the place looks like it's frequented by regulars.  i ordered a drink and made a beeline to the seat by the window since she was running late from a meal in the mission.

i brought my own cigars but they have a selection to choose from. personally i prefer the bauzas petit corona or sometimes for a quickie, eileen's or kahlua petite cigars.  i got used to puffin' on the smaller cigars since i hate shivering outside without a drink in my hand by myself.

ok, back to the bar.   guess the other reviews liked the atmosphere - it's like a pub nothing fancy.   it's small, you can smoke, you can buy smokes, friendly folk.  end of story.
author: Anh V.

description:
A great place! 
Friendly and pleasant all the way around. A fine bar and little cigar nook offer a wide range of drinks and fine tobaccos~ stop by for a drink and a smoke some evening
author: Gregory S.

description: Great place to come relax with a few friends.  Beautiful bar, intimate atmosphere, and for an indoor cigar bar, this place is pretty well ventilated.  They pour a generous glass of wine, and offer a large selection of whiskies.
author: Kristen H.

description: The Occidental has a great selection of whiskeys and cigars. Even if you're just an occasionally smoker like me, it's an enjoyable place to go. Every time I've been there I've met some great people, usually even someone who will buy me a cigar out of the kindness of their heart.
author: Josh O.

description: Stumble upon this small, intimate smoking bar complete with an owner for a bartender, generous with the drinks. This cigar club meets all your relaxation expectations: sit back, have a drink and a smoke, a little conversation, a whole lot of great atmosphere. You can't go wrong at the Occidental.
author: Dawn L.

description:
this place is damn awesome. a plethora of choices for fine, classy drinks (college student - very classy).  wasn't sporting the largest selection of cigars, which seemed a bit pricey, but what else do you expect?? the place is old fashioned & classy as hell.  i love the whole look of the place from the witty signs to the various corner kick it spots and oversized ashtrays EVERYWHERE. the music is the perfect volume so you can speak with the person next to you and have good ass convos. 

everyone i met was awesome here.  there needs to be more places like this on mother earth.
author: Victor B.

description: The Occidental is my favorite hangout to have a really good cigar and drink.  Jake and Jack are wonderful, they pour good drinks have an excellent selection of single malts, rums, cognacs, armagnacs and even calvados!   The cigar selection is always top choice and the ambiance is perfect.  It's even a great place to relax after dinner at Belden Place.  Visit this bar as often as you can and make sure to say hello to Jake and Jack for me.
author: Jonathon J.

description: I love this place.  Not a large selection of cigars but I've enjoyed a few memorable smokes there over the last year and a half.  They have a wonderful selection of dark rum as well - possibly the best rum I've found in San Francisco.  Their whiskey selection is, of course, exquisite as well.  The best part of this place is the fact that you can join the "club" and they will give you a private humidor.  The second best part of this club is the fact that it's the only place I know (other than  my home or any of the venerable private golf institutions in the city) where I can play liar's dice, smoke a cigar, drink and watch golf at the same time.
author: Charles W.

description: One of my favorite place to play liar's dice, drink, talk smack, and smoke up in the Financial District.
author: Ni G.

description: I like the fact that you still can smoke in a bar in the city.  Only discovered the Occidental after it was a clue in this year's Chinese New Year Treasure Hunt.  This hangout is next to Belden Place, so after your drinks and nibbles, you can skirt around the corner and puff on a cigar or ciggie.  Quite a few dudes dressed like the Rat Pack, but there are regular folk kicking back as well.  Nice place to hang.
author: brewgirl b.

description: I brought my own cigars, but their humidor has a number of interesting choices, and they have a pretty good selection of scotch.  Other than at the bar, seating is at a number of small tables with high-backed barstools.  It's smaller than I expected, but it's quiet and well ventilated
author: James D.

description: I smoke (though not cigars) but the three Js and Bubba along with a supporting cast of real characters (and its proximity to my work) are what keep me coming back here all the time.
author: Michael W.

description: This is the only public establishment where you can drink and smoke at the bar!! Not sure how the new SF ordinance is going to impact Occidental, but this is a great intimate place to have a drink and a smoke. Adjacent to the financial district, it can be crowded (after work hours), but wide open during the weekends. Cigar selection is decent, nothing to rave about, but you can bring your own smokes there too. Drink selections are good and the service is great. A must-stop for any cigar aficionado!
author: Henry F.

description: Went there for the first time and was treated very, VERY WELL. It is a good bar.....no make that a GREAT bar, the Bartender, Lance, was just about the best I have seen in a long, long time.....it was so good I returned after my meal out the next evening and was treated even better than the evening before, like I was an old friend.....It is very hard to find these kind of places any longer. GO!
author: francis A.

description: This place is great. You can have a cigar and a scotch on the rocks inside! This is a wonderful place for friends to hang out and chill. The owner is super friendly and really knowledgeable with regards to cigars. First time having a cigar and he taught me a lot about cigars and what things mean. I will definitely go there again and know what is going on a lot more.
author: Mark M.

description: you can enjoy a cigar inside, 'nuff said.
author: Rob B.

description: not a cigar smoker. i am usually with friends who like cigars and i dont like them so i dont really know whats so great about this spot. expensive drinx and old dudes talking about their business trips.
author: Wats C.
